Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: janiceks
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Gold Coast. Registration was a breeze and the person helping us was friendly and very helpful with suggestions. Our room was clean, clean, clean. The bed was extremely comfortable and ensured a great night's sleep. The bathroom and was a nice size and I loved the shower. I have nothing negative to say about my experience at the Gold Coast except I wish I could have won a little money. Everyone was friendly. I will return and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, efficient, quiet stay”
Reviews.Author: Lakevic
Reviews.Content: Tried first to book at the Orleans but that hotel was full. Decided to try the Gold Coast and wasn't disapointed. Convenient location not far from the strip, the king room was spacious enough with all the standard amenities included.Comfy clean bed, the housekeeping service was excellent as well. When I called to ask for a replacement iron as the one in the room looked broken, within minutes someone came by with a brand new iron. Would definetely consider staying here again on my next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: GASt.Marys
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gold Coast for 3 nights and couldn't have been happier with my stay. I stayed about three years ago and loved it. Another reviewer mentioned that you could not get points at table games with your players card. That is just not true. I played strictly blackjack and accrued enough points that they comped my entire stay, including meals. The entire staff, from the front desk, dealers, restaurant employees, etc. were very friendly and easy to deal with. I stayed in a standard room and the room was spotless. Housekeeping did a great job. I will definitely go back when I'm in Las Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value , close to Rio and Palms”
Reviews.Author: yaahoos
Reviews.Content: We got a deal for 3 nights for $99 plus an entry into a Slot Tournament. An extra $39 and we had 2 entries into Slot Tourney. It was a quick fun slot tourney , held for 2 days at a set time, and took 30 minutes of our time. My wife won $100 by coming in 20th ! Almost paid for the room. Nice cafe, great food , 1/2 price buffet deal, cheaper card table minimums ($5) . Valet very quick, free strip shuttle, great location for a quick walk to the RIO and Palms across the street. Room was smaller in size but still comfortable for 2. Single cup coffee maker was nice but we bought a 10 cup coffee maker for $10 at Walmart, brought our own Tim Hortons coffee and creamer and indulged every morning. All in all a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Gold Coast”
Reviews.Author: James W
Reviews.Content: Went to the Gold Coast to watch all of the March Madness games. The setup was great with lots of TVs in the conference room, in room food and beverage. Two betting stations made wagering convenient. The gaming tables were at the bottom of the escalator and easy to get to. The pit bosses in the craps area are awesome - very friendly and make the game a great time. The hotel was good too - rooms were clean and somewhat updated. The breakfast buffet was the best deal going for $6.00. Overall much better than I was expecting and definitely plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Off Strip comfort and convenience”
Reviews.Author: Rogerdodjer
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay at the Gold Coast and once again I was not disappointed with my experience there. I was in Vegas for the NASCAR race and chose the Gold Coast for its value, smaller size and all around good time. From check in to check out, the staff was very friendly and helpful and made you feel welcome, premium room was very comfortable and clean and not subject to exorbitant resort fees. I will be back again for the race weekend in 2013.

Reviews.Title: “Million Mile Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Ray F
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stay at the Gold Coast on most of our trips to Las Vegas. We like this property because of the very helpful staff, fun main bar, sports book and variety of slot machines. A little about our experience: 1. The rooms are nice, great mattress, flat screen TV, updated bathroom with coffee maker. I would like to see a safe in the room, but valuables can be stored free in the cashier area. 2. Plenty of slots and table games. I like that the video poker machines allow you to split aces or double down. There are some casinos that don't offer this type of play. This is where the locals go to play... I lost a ticket once and thought that it was lost. A half hour after I reported it missing the manager tracked me down at another machine and paid me for my lost ticket that wasn't cashed in. That was quite a surprise! 3. Main Bar provides great service and you can always find people laughing and having a good time. I have never experienced an empty glass... 4. Restaurants/Buffet are very good and reasonably priced

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: Jerie R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights. Room rate was $34 (+$3/day resort fee) for an upgraded King Smoking Room. We were on the 9th floor. Had great view of the Stratosphere and night lights. Very clean and comfortable. Thermostat for heat and air. We love the bingo parlor. Staff (bellman, valet & desk clerk) was nice. Our shampoo and body wash disappeared the first day we were there and staff and management showed little concern. You really can't beat this place for a nice room at a low price. Buffet is not good. We went for breakfast and on steak night. Steaks are about 1/2" thick. Breakfast generally a grease pit but lots of variety.

Reviews.Title: “This place smells funny...”
Reviews.Author: gretel2381
Reviews.Content: DISCLAIMER: This is just a review of the lobby and food. I did not stay in a room at the Gold Coast (I was across the street at the Rio). My group walked over to the Gold Coast to eat at the TGI Friday's and the buffet. As soon as we entered the lobby, we were smacked in the face with a very pungent chemical odor...I couldn't tell exactly what it was, but it smelled like a VERY strong air freshener or cleaning chemical of some sort. I literally had to hold my breath to get through the casino to the buffet (which was excellent and a great value). The service at the TGI Friday's was very slow and the restaurant wasn't even that busy at the time. I have to say that I'm glad I didn't have to stay there, I don't know that I could have gotten use to the stench in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “good and the bad of the gold coast”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller715
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the gold coast from 3/10-3/16 and here is my review of the hotel. GOOD: rooms are clean, fairly good sized although the toilet / shower area is small. price was reasonable for a vegas hotel. cost us $325 for 6 nites total, including taxes, fees and of course the dreaded DRF daily resort fee which is ONLY $3 per day at the Gold Coast. it has cheapest DRF of all the hotels that charge this fee. the average DRF is $15 and goes as high as $25 at some of the strip hotels. our room had only faint smell of cigarettes in it so wasnt too bad. The buffet at the GC is average, the price is decent. i think it was $6 for breakfast $13 for lunch and $16 for dinner. TIP#1 get the B-Connected card which is free to get at the GC and they knock a $1 off of every buffet meal PP so you save a few bucks with this card. breakfast was our favorite buffet meal. the omelet station is very good. other buffet highlights: the prime rib dinner buffet is very good. they have ice cream for dessert for lunch and dinner. nothing too fancy here at the buffets. we did eat here a lot as it was just convenient for us with all the other things we wanted to do in vegas. BAD: walls arent too thick so we were bothered by adjoining room on 2 nites with someone talking loudly. 2nd nite we complained and they sent security up to tell him to keep it down and we didnt hear a peep out of him after that. so props to the front desk and security for taking care of this so we could sleep. i know its vegas and all but its very annoying laying there listening to someone carry on about how great kobe bryant is for hours for 2nites. we stayed at sams town several years ago and we liked the buffet food and the size of the bathroom more then the GC. bottom line: if you want a cheap hotel that is 1 mile from the strip ( very convenient ) low DRF $3 with average buffet then the GC is right for you. would we stay here again. probably not as we will try a different hotel the next time just to see if we can get something better for around the same price. i was surprised at the very good reviews that this hotel got as i would not rate it as high as other people seemed to rate this hotel but then again i have only stayed at 2 hotels in vegas: sams town and the gold coast so this is my reference points to compare.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice- Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: paulobster
Reviews.Content: We had played once at the Gold Coast and were pleasantly surprised to receive a generous offer for a room, food and free play. The room ended up being one of their very comfortable suites. I was happy to see in an in-room coffee maker along with a nice sitting area. The bed was so comfy that I ended up taking a mid-day nap. As others have pointed out, the casino can be smokey however I just move when a power puffer sits down next to me. The staff is very nice and helpful. The Cortez Room is "old school" Vegas with very good food that doesn't nickel and dime you on sides and salads- all included with the main dish. Service was a little slow however we did hit them with a large group later in the evening. The Seafood Olympia was a great mixture of seafood served on angel hair pasta- a large serving that I couldn't finish. This is a smaller "locals" casino however a terrific choice. I know that we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: Erinko
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and in good condition. It's an older property, so it's not too luxurious. We knew we would be out and about most of the time and not at the hotel so that was perfect for us. It is not on the strip, but close to it and they have shuttles going pretty often. We never went to the pool, so I can not speak to that. The work out room was small, but clean and served it's purpose. The staff originally put us in a room that hadn't been cleaned yet. When we brought that to their attention they not only switched our room, but gave us vouchers for their breakfast buffet. If you want a good value, and nothing fancy, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Gold Coast!”
Reviews.Author: Roxy4410
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas as a surprise for my husbands 26th birthday. I wanted the Hotel Casino experience but also to stay somewhere cheaper, as we would not be spending a lot of time in our room so a co-worker recommended the Gold Coast Hotel and Casino! We had a fabulous stay and were so impressed with this place! The hotel staff is SO nice- the front desk, housekeeping, bar tenders, security, shuttle bus drivers and on. Everyone was so friendly and so helpful! Our room was great, I believe it was one that had been remodeled. It was very spacious, clean, and very comfortable. We called housekeeping for a few items, and they were delivered promptly! There is a free shuttle bus that runs about every 30ish minutes to the Orleans and then to the strip (dropping off next to Bill's Gamblin Hall). We ate at the buffet for breakfast one morning. It was great and priced really well- $5.99/person. Sign up free for a Players Card (B-Connected) and receive $1 off the buffets at all Sam's Town Properties. Thanks Gold Coast for a great experience! We have already recommended this place to friends. We had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bcrver
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Gold Coast was a great experience. Friendly staff and lots of fun machines made us reserve another 3 day stay. The second stay introduced us to the great restarants and fair priced menus with tasty dishes. Gold Coast is my #1 recommendation for Las Vegas. We will surely stay again on our next trip .

Reviews.Title: “Average, could probably do better elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: gardog
Reviews.Content: I give the Gold Coast an average rating based on my visit the week of Feb. 27th. The room is clean, comfortable, the bed is good, but the bathroom is woefully small and cramped. I was not in a premium room but the bathrooms are all the same size I am told. Service was satisfactory but it was the minimum I would expect at any hotel. Good location, inexpensive. Pool was open unlike premium properties that shut down the pool for the winter. The casino help is not as friendly or helpful, and the low ceilings make this casino a bit smokier than newer ones. Buffet is very inexpensive and fine for breakfast, just so so for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem Just Off Strip To The West”
Reviews.Author: Vegas2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the GC from Friday Nov 11th to Tuesday Nov 15th. It was a busy weekend with it being 11/11/11 so hundreds of weddings were happening, add in the Marquez vs Manny fight. I got to the GC close to 6:30pm, and check-in was quick. Small front desk but no line up. This was my 3rd time staying at the Gold Coast (Jan '09, May '11, Nov '11), and I have never been disappointed. The rooms are big, I have only stayed in the standard room, with a flat scfreen tv, comfy beds. The bathroom is small, but I don't mind really. Room is clean and seems quiet each time I am there. The casino is laid out nicely, easy to navigate with lots of slots. The buffet I enjoy for breakfast and it is really cheap. TGIF is a decent place for even a late night eat as it is open 24 hours. I like the fact they have a free shuttle, you go to The Orleans first then to The Strip. Seems most of the people on it when you get on, are getting off at The Orleans. I believe 30 people can only fit so make sure you are there early. Coming back you may not get on as the dop off/pick up beside Bill's Gamblin Hall gets quite the line up. Sometimes I will take the bus back, or maybe walk in the day. The Rio and Palms are right next door and across the street so if you are more for gambling, you really have no need to go to The Strip. As well with all 3 properties, lots to choose from to eat. Best thing is, the walk to and from your oom is not like the mega resorts where you need a golf cart. Easy short walk. The staff are terrific at GC, always pleasant and helpful. I am looking forward to my next stay for the Memorial Day weekend. Only drawback is, if you are out on The Strip past midnight, you will need to cab it back, so your best bet is get to Bally's or Bill's and grab a cab, it will be a short jaunt and less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Quiet, Premium Room!”
Reviews.Author: latrice
Reviews.Content: This casino hotel was a Best stay for me and my family. Premium rooms have a large (r) bathroom with a large wrap around counter. Flat screen TV. 2 Queen nice mattresses. The blanket is not good. ( think bad bumpy blanket..) Loved the security in the hotel. The buffett is good for breakfast but adequate for lunch. I didnt have dinner there so no review for that. The casino is L shaped so not so much to get lost. I gambled a bit at the Coast but did not win so much. The Orleans had much better pay offs. The shuttle is good but does fill up fast. For some reason people that get to the shuttle seem not be able to recognize that other people are there before them so they cattle shoot the shuttle. I think the Coast needs to put in a Line system. Stay above 4th floor. Ask for North East facing room. We were in # 458 bout 3/4 down the hall on the west side. the East side will prolly show more Vegas lights. We saw the Stratsophere but thats about all. Enjoyed my stay at the Gold Coast.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Well Taken Care of Property”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior10069
Reviews.Content: Valet/check-in/arrival at room was without incident and fast. My first trip to this slightly off strip casino/hotel was in '88 when it opened and I've probably returned a handful of times over the years. The rooms are adequate though the bathroom facilities are small. Everything was clean and everything worked. Flat screen TV, decent bed, a window that opened, a rudimentary coffee maker setup, and plenty of hot water. The lobby has been remodeled and the old coffee shop is now a TGIF. The Cortez room serves up some good if somewhat pricey but well prepared chow. The buffet is large with plenty of choices but nothing out of the ordinary. I used it for breakfast mostly and dinner once. The dinner buffet was probably the less impressive of the two. A very nice selection of desserts. The TGIF is about what you'd expect. Table minimums in the casino were five dollars. Lots of Pai Gow type games - seems to be their thing as well as baccarat and a couple of five dollar crap tables, Three Card poker, Blackjack etc. No Let It Ride. Tons of slots. For slots I prefer Laughlin as they are markedly looser. The accountants have really screwed those Vegas machines down tight. All in all a pleasant place just far enough away from the strip that the table minimums are doable. Rio and the Palms are just across the street. Hourly shuttle service is available to the strip. Certain top shelf liquors are no longer comped at the bar when you're playing the machines.

Reviews.Title: “great get away”
Reviews.Author: Mark R
Reviews.Content: 35. Favorite Casino? Gold Coast 36. Why is the casino you selected above one of your favorites? my family has been coming from new york to the gold coast for 27+ years and we love the way they treat us and how laid back it is when you just want to get away from the busyness of vegas 43. Did you experience any issue, concern or perhaps something extraordinarily pleasant on your latest visit to the Gold Coast? Y - Yes 44. Please describe the circumstances: on our last day there the slot host said he didnt want us to leave and gave us another free night and then dinner at the cortez room 45. Was the issue resolved to your satisfaction? Y - Yes

Reviews.Title: “The Gold Coast is a real GEM”
Reviews.Author: Thomas T
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong staying, eating, gambling, etc at the Gold Coast. You won't be nailed with the Strip prices for accommodations, food or drink. The Gold Coast has a shuttle bus that will take you to other Casinos such as the Orleans, Suncoast and Sam's Town. The rooms are VERY nice, the location is fabulous (across the street from the Palms) and ALL the restaurants are better than good! The casino is a "local" favorite and the valet service at the Gold Coast is second to none. We enjoy their El Cortez room as a first rate dining establishment without the outlandish cost of a similar top shelf Strip restuarant. You can't go wrong - visit the Gold Coast to stay, play and enjoy Vegas to the max.

Reviews.Title: “Premium Room at Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: Toni W
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Gold Coast twice (each time for only a night each) but I have to say I will continue to recommend this place for those wanting to go to Vegas but not pay on the Strip hotel prices. The premium room is super affordable, clean and modern. It's a great room for the price you pay and it's only a hop, skip and jump away from the Strip. Plus it's a casino hotel so you dont have to travel far to gamble.

Reviews.Title: “We can always count on the Gold Coast for quality”
Reviews.Author: jmzr2450
Reviews.Content: Vegas is always where we go to meet up with family from all over the US. Every time we are in town the Gold Coast restaurant "The Cortez Room" is the only choice for our family dinners. We can be confident that we will receive a great meal, impeccable service at a good value. We have been doing this since 1987 and will continue to do so. We love the Gold Coast and Cortez room.

Reviews.Title: “Next to Rio at <half the price.”
Reviews.Author: mnwyatt22
Reviews.Content: Rooms are in good condition. Take Wynn street down to Spring Hill and China town/ Asian district for lots of great food. Bargain

Reviews.Title: “Zero Comps”
Reviews.Author: Louis291
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 1-2 times per year for the oast 7 years. I just checked out on 2/10/12 and discovered they no longer issue comps for table game play. They would not even comp the $3.00 daily resort fee. Why don't they inform the guest's of this new policy before reservation's are made??? Everyone should know of this policy that are thinking of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: DMA58
Reviews.Content: Feb 6, 2012. Just got back from a 5 day stay here (our 3rd time). If you want a low cost vacation and an affordable gambling venue, this hotel is a good value for the money. It caters to both locals and tourists and tends to have an older crowd. We came in on Sunday and left Friday and paid $29.00/night (including the usual fees and taxes). It's an older hotel, but bright and clean. The rooms are basic and clean and the beds are comfortable. The staff is friendly and security is excellent. One night in the casino one of the locals got mad at a friend and started yelling obscenities. Within seconds 4 security guards removed him from the building. Five dollar table games are plentiful here, and there is nightly entertainment. You can walk across the street to either the Rio or the Palms. The Orleans, (another Coast Casino) and the "Strip" are about a mile away. We rented a car but I think they offer free shuttle service to the above. The only negative thing I have to say is that we didn't like the buffet. For years it had one of the best reputations around, but it has declined in recent years. It must be an isolated problem because we drove to Sam's Town (another Coast property) and had the best buffet ever.

Reviews.Title: “Basic in every way, its about the price, location and gambling....”
Reviews.Author: Dan T
Reviews.Content: I think I knew what I was getting when I booked the room, but the photos made the rooms seem much nicer. The hotel is quite old and I decided to check in there for the $30.00 a night rate. I checked in around 630pm, and headed upstairs to the 6th floor. The elevators were punctual and quick. The room reminded me of an older Holiday Inn Express. There was nothing new about the decor, but I did like the fact the beds were wrapped in sheet rather than those horrible old bedspreads that match the curtains and smell like Billy Goat. After unpacking I took a shower and even though the decor reminded me of a track home built in the late 50's the shower head rocked!!! I weak stream of water is one thing I hate. This stream was right on, easily able to loosen up the old neck. Location, location! This hotel houses one of the best low limit blackjack scenes around! I easily found a seat on a $5 dollar table. The hotel also houses one of the best Chinese food places in Vegas! I had a noodle dish, tender beef dish and hot and sour soup. Perfect to mix with the beers I had been drinking. The hotel is also across from the Palms Hotel with a great movie theaters. When I woke up I went across the street and watch two movies to pass the day before heading out to the airport. Sure, the room wasn't glamorous but I do think I got a little more than what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you have limited choices”
Reviews.Author: mizdiz517
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Gold Coast after having stayed at the other Boyd properties in Las Vegas so I will be comparing this stay to those places (i.e. Orleans, Sams Town) rather than comparing GC to the mega strip hotels. Front Desk personnel were very friendly (although my guy was still training so check in took longer than necessary) and amenable to my complimentary upgrade request. We ended up in a Premium King room rather than deluxe or standard which I highly recommend since these have been renovated with newer furnishings and carpeting. The room itself is pretty basic, (no fridge, no safe) with a nice flat screen tv and the standard hard flat pillows that are common to all Boyd properties. The linens are decent but you may want to request an extra blanket since there isn't one in the room. BEWARE::::rooms at the ends of the hall don't get HOT water (someone else wrote something about that here but I had forgotten about it until I got a room at the end of the hall and had to take a shower with tepid water. I moved the next day to a middle room on the 4th floor and the water was fine) Restaurants: Ping Pang Pong -- I tried this based on other positive TA reviews but it is not for me. I guess I just don't get the whole dim sum thing and none of the servers spoke much English so it was hard to figure out what they were trying to offer me. The concept is interesting with them rolling a bunch of carts around the restaurant, stopping at each table to offer food (even if the food is indescribable) but I would prefer to see a menu with food choices and prices. Noodle Exchange -- this is more of a traditional Asian restaurant with fairly good food and very good prices. We had the Bento box lunches more than once. Buffet -- the buffet does not have a lot to offer as far as choices, but the food here was also okay. If you are a big buffet fan, there are a lot better ones to choose from in town like the Rio which is within walking distance. If you don't want to leave the hotel, the buffet is fine but not a first choice. Red Zone Bar -- advertises things like wings, pizza, burgers but it turns out that they basically order the food for you from the snack bar at the bowling alley upstairs and then have someone run it down. Not that this is a bad thing, but it is snack bar food so don't expect anything elaborate. TGI Fridays -- is open 24 hours and the menu is the same here that you will find at any TGIF in this country. The breakfast, however, is especially good and very reasonably priced. We ate here every morning and tried pretty much everything they had to offer (eggs, pancakes, french toast, etc.) and it was all good. Java Vegas -- typical Starbucks wanna-be cafe with bakery items. Nothing outstanding to recommend here. There is no spa on the premises (sadly). The pool area was open even though it was too cold to swim but people did try the hot tub. It is a small area, no ambiance, and the pool is small as well. The 70 lane bowling alley is very nice for a family activity and it contains a small arcade. The casino is not too large but laid out very well with a good mix of slot and video poker machines. All of the table games are centrally located but they are right next to the sports book which is wide open so the area gets very noisy. The cocktail waitresses come around frequently so that is a big plus. Although there is really nothing wrong with this property, if you are looking for a nice off strip hotel with good payback on the machines and a good price for the rooms, you are probably better off choosing the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “A decent off strip property worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentReview
Reviews.Content: Ok, most of the reviews are fairly accurate. Hotels: The rooms are small as is typical of old vegas. I was in an upgraded room on the 8th floor. modern and clean, bad pillows (a pet peeve) good flatscreen TV. NOTE: if noise is a concern ask for a north facing room otherwise the south is in the direction of the casinos air conditioning system. The halls can be long so if thats a concern ask for something closer to the elevators. While it should be nice regardless, How much time will you be spending in the room The dreaded resort fee: if youve read my other reviews you know that resort fees pss me off. If you advertise a room at 50.00 that should be it ( plus tax of course) to be forced to pay a fee for standard hotel services OR other services youll never use is obscene and should be illegal. And things you need, i.e. internet. is usually ridiculously priced. How can you compare hotels rates when there may be a resort fee at one property and not at another. Who wants to search in detail to find if theres a resort fee when they advertise a fee which does not include it. Since its mandatory it should be part of the rate quote! whats next ..a bed fee?? Ive seen reviews of these types of properties where they mention Vdara, Venetian,Caesars, Bellagio. Thats absurd! You cant compare a 29.00 hotel with a 400.00 property Casino; large and with all the modern machines and table games. Can be VERY smoky however if find that the norm in most casinos. If you have a players card ( and you should) you can use it for discounts on food, liquor etc. The gift shop - liquor outlet is quire reasonable. Your card gets an additional 10% off the well priced booze. FOOD: The noodle bar has great lunch specials. The locally famous Ping Pang Pong is authentic asian food BEWARE: Its authentic asian food that asians eat, its NOT the american asian food such as Panda Express. It is fresh and expertly prepared. There is a 24 hour Friday's with breakfast lunch and dinner specials. They also accept Friday's coupons. OVERALL: A decent first time visit. If you are expecting luxury try a higher end property however this is a nice place. * If you find this helpful please click on 'helpful' so I know im being coherent :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and a great value”
Reviews.Author: RTfromSD
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to the National Finals Rodeo and my first stay at the Gold Coast. Front desk was quick and efficient. I had a premium room on the 7th floor and it was decent. Not sure why, but I only got housekeeping one night. No big deal as I was the only one in the room and had plenty of towels. I didn't use the shuttle as I had a rental car. Parking was plentiful and close by. Lots of food choices and reasonable prices too. I will most likely stay here again, I like the bang for the buck, and the relaxed rodeo atmosphere was great.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, depending on your expectations”
Reviews.Author: CL5309
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several hotels in LV including Palazzo, Venetian, Mandalay Bay, Vdara, Treasure Island and Bellagio. Typically my wfe and I stay on the strip but prefer to gamble at Gold Coast because the table minimums are low and they have a nice Bingo room which my wife enjoys playing at. Food at the buffet is good deal for the price and staff and dealers are helpful and friendly. So when we recieved a postcard from GC with a comped room offer, we decided to try it out. We figured we'd save time and cab fare by staying where we typically gamble. We also figured if room was terrible we would move to one of the aforementioned properties that we've stayed at before and liked. I thought the reviews on trip advisor were helpful and generally accurate, but I think the variability in reviews is a function of people's expectations vs. variations in room or service quality. I typically stay at the hotels listed above and 4/5 star properties when I travel on business (see my other reviews). While the Gold Coast hotel room we received was clean and quiet, we would not stay here again even if room was free. That doesn't mean I wouldn't recommend it to others. Gold Coast reminds me of a truck stop hotel - somewhere you'd stay on a long road trip when you're too tired to keep driving. Ok for a night but not a destination by any stretch of the imagination. Pros: clean, quiet, hallways no longer than any other large hotel in LV Cons: Very small room (think dorm room with a small bathroom), bathroom door is a sliding door that makes a lot of noise to open/close in the middle of the night, strange/dated decor (again, it's like your kid's dorm room full of hand-me-down stuff you no longer want in your house), flat panel TV was nothing special and had very poor reception, internet was $15/day. I will still come here to gamble and eat (plus gift shop has cheapest alcohol in the area) but won't stay here in the future, even if room is free.

Reviews.Title: “Winter Trip 2012”
Reviews.Author: CC_Poky
Reviews.Content: Good place for the money. Bed was good and room was nice. The bathroom, especially the shower/toilet area was very small.

Reviews.Title: “kinda ok”
Reviews.Author: larjan
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are clean but woren. Ok for a very short stay. Restaurants inside are fine.

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes you get less than what you payed for”
Reviews.Author: emengee
Reviews.Content: This poor review is not because of the poor location, infrequent shuttle service, hidden "resort fee", dingy bathroom or view of a wall. It's not because the pool is small and poorly located. It's not because we had to wait to get the TV fixed or that the internet was not working properly. It's not even because we had to ask to be moved because we were directly over the nightclub and the boom boom boom of the bass prevented our sleep. It's because the front desk moved us with such reluctance and without apology for our inconvenience, and IT IS inconvenient to repack and drag your bags back down to the front desk. At this hotel there is quite a distance from room elevators to the front desk. You are also made to navigate through a vast expanse of slot machines. While it is only early evening here in Vegas, we've undergone a 3 hour time difference, so it is late for us and we're tired. The "new" room is further down the hall from the previous one, so it was quite a trek. The internet doesn't work there either. Oh well. We've got this hotels measure by now. Luckily there are plenty of other hotels. BTW - although this place was inexpensive, we have rebooked ( on Hotwire ) to a better, newer hotel on the strip, at a LOWER COST. No shuttle, no "resort fee". If you read my previous reviews you will see that I am a big believer in you get what you pay for. Unfortunately-sometimes, like at the Gold Coast, you get less. I would like to make it clear that in no way was our manner demanding or rude. We did not ask for an upgrade, but sort of expected it I guess, if truth be told. We've been upgraded for less cause. Beware of the lastest cash grab, "resort fees", an extra charge which hotels divulge very reluctantly. They say it is to cover shuttle service, pool, fitness room, etc. In other words, it's an extra fee to cover the costs for the amenities which were featured in the room cost when you booked the hotel, as included. What a rip. There are many hotels here who advertise that they do not charge this. My advice is to ask in advance, protest if they do and take your business elsewhere. At the Gold Coast it is $3.00, at Treasure Island it's $20.00! The consumer can make a difference. OK - because I'm on a roll, I'll just mention that I have never seen a buffet omelet bar leave out a dollar bill on the counter in the expectation of scoring a tip. Tacky.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Latinhunny33
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before an event. Great rate, remodeled room. There is a parking garage attached, bit of a hike to the rooms but worth it to not have your car roasting under the Vegas sun. Bathroom was a bit weird with the sliding door, didn't completely close but worked its' function. Beds were comfortable, hotel & rooms were clean. There is a TGIFridays in the lobby. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good food great price minimal waiting”
Reviews.Author: Yonetta K
Reviews.Content: Forget staying at the RIO for all the nice things they have service sucks! Can stand in line hours (3-4) for the carnival buffet and then pay 31.99 to eat. So frustrated we walked outside and seen the Gold Coast breakfast was $5.99 all you can eat! They have a bowling alley too. The staff act like they would like you to come again. The coffee shop pastries were huge and noodle exchange was another hit! From the first day we set foot in Gold Coast we came over every morning and evening. The lines were reasonable the food was good and we had a great time. Will definitely visit them again!

Reviews.Title: “cheap price with clean room ,really good restaurant inside hotel”
Reviews.Author: congchihan
Reviews.Content: we have been staying this Hotel twice .We always had good time .The Dim Sum is so good .Buffet is very cheap $7.99 only for lunch .They also have T.G Friday inside hotel .The room is clean , flat screen TV,free coffee in room everyday . Free shuttle from and to the Strip until midnight .If you have small kids ,feel free to ask them a crib ,they'll bring to your room no extra fee. The front desk was very helpful and nice .They have magic show on weekend and live music with dancing every night with very cheap price. We'll coming back again to this hotel if we in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Cheapskates Visit the Gold Coast”
Reviews.Author: hereandthere
Reviews.Content: We are addicted budget travellers and our favorite game is finding the best deal for the least amount of money. Our mid December choice for five nights in Vegas became the Gold Coast even though sister property, The Orleans, was equally priced. Top marks went to reception for allowing us early check-in (10:55am) and then assigning a nice room on the 8th floor. We love smaller hotels like the Gold Coast with short corridors and rooms near the elevators. The room was well furnished with a comfortable bed, large flat screen television and a partial view of the Strip, but we wondered why the Gold Coast (and most other hotels) only provide one luggage stand when most rooms are occupied by two people. The bathroom was spacious but with shower only (no bathtub). We were travelling with the usual electronic equipment, computer and ipod, but found there was no safe in the room. We opened a safety depoist account at the Cashier's Cage to leave our valuables, which was a tiny bit of a hassle even though the agent was friendly and full of fun, but we had to leave our computer in the room. It was not a problem but in many places around the world where we have stayed there would have been. Large room safes would be a nice upgrade. We always love the Gold Coast buffets for selection, quality of food and price. We were not disappointed and enjoyed several breakfasts including made to order omlettes. Our friends visited Ping Pang Pong twice and raved about the delicious Asian food. Even though we were not too lucky in the casino, we were lucky in most other areas, food, room quality, shuttle service, location (close enough to walk to the Strip), and the thrill and excitement of just being there.

Reviews.Title: “another good stay”
Reviews.Author: nuggetboy
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 3 night stay at the GC. This was probably our 7-8th stay at the property and obviously we like the place. We stayed in a premium room on the 6th floor. The room was clean and well appointed as always. We made sure to get a room not at the end of the hallway to make sure we had plenty of hot water (slight problem I reported in an earlier review). The buffet opens at 7 AM (important for earlier risers like us) and is a good, solid value with good food. The service providers are all very friendly and polite. The dealers are fun and try to make losing as soft as possible. It is also NOT overrun by families with kids. It makes for a much better, more relaxing Vegas experience. The only negative thing I can say about the place relates to the lack of safes in the rooms. Because there was no safe in the room I went downstairs to the cashier's cage to put our cash in a safe deposit box. Normally I wouldn't have that large of an amount to be worried about, but this was our first stop on a 14 night Vegas stay. The process of getting a box is lengthy and requires a $100 deposit. I was told if I lost the key I would lose the deposit and be charged an additional $150 to drill out the box. That seemed excessive. When i closed the box three days later it again took 10 minutes and required several signatures. The process was much longer , complicated and expensive than any other place I've stayed. Still the cashiers are pleasant and the onerous process does not deter us from staying at the GC on our next visit. I'll just bring less money.

Reviews.Title: “Salsa Saturdays...for $10...entry plus 2 drinks!”
Reviews.Author: jsaul
Reviews.Content: We have gone 4 or 5 times. The ballroom on Saturdays is a great place for Salsa dancing. It has a spacious wooden floor surrounded by tables. In December they had a live band which took a while to warm up, but 1/2 way through the evening got hot. During band breaks the DJ played Bachata, Cha Cha Cha, Merengue, & Bolero. It was fairly crowded so service was slow. To save time I ordered drinks at the bar. We have always had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: sally 21
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Gold Coast and even though it is an older off strip hotel it's still good value for money. Check in was quick and easy and Kim on reception was polite and happy.We were on the 9th floor and had a smoking room.Room was really big and had an enormous bed which was very comfortable( my only complaint was that i found the pillows a little hard) Bathroom is small but it does the job that it is intended for.Shower was powerfull and hot. Housekeeping came every day and the room was always very clean with fresh towels, toiletries and coffee. Room had the usual,tv,coffee maker, iron and ironing board.Also had a table and chairs and internet connection ( don't know how well this worked as we didn't use it ) The only thing the room didnt have was a safe, but then you can get a safety deposit box at the cashier station. We ate breakfast at the buffet a times which wasn't too bad.We also tried the noodle exchange which was good and very popular.There are a few other restaurants at the hotel along with a large bowling alley.If you have a car there is loads of parking available. Hotel runs a shuttle bus to the strip which stops at the Orleans before heading to the strip.This runs about every 15 mins and is included in your room price.

Reviews.Title: “Another Visit to Gold Coast”
Reviews.Author: MinneWiggie
Reviews.Content: Another year and its time to spend a few days in Vegas - Staying at the Gold Coast is in the plans. It is still a great place to stay and play. They make you feel at home and do everythng to make your visit enjoyable. Convenient travel to the strip if you desire. So spend some time in Vegas and the Gold Coast. You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “NFR 2011”
Reviews.Author: Greg A
Reviews.Content: The Gold Coast Has a Party Atmosphere But is a Quiet, Clean, No Hassel Hotel and Casino. Their food selection is GREAT and the Value is FANTASTIC. They offer a Free shuttle to the Strip that runs every few minutes and they work Hard to make your stay enjoyable. A deffinate Go back again Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient...Great Food..Games and Courteous People”
Reviews.Author: allan m
Reviews.Content: The big Strip Hotels are mad houses of tourists who aren't staying there clogging up the Lobby to Gawk at a glass sculpture or a phony New York Or Paris Street...The Gold Coast and the Orleans cater to those of us who go there for gaming, food and fun...We always rent a car because the parking is a cinch..We go over to the Strip for the Shows..we stay at the Gold Coast for the real experience of Las Vegas!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BAD & SCARY TREATMENT BY THE FOOD & BEVERAGE MANAGER”
Reviews.Author: renato d
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were having drinks in front of the showroom bar at about 7pm of Nov 5, 2011 when a security guard asked us to leave because as he stated,they have to clean the place. I told him that before we ordered drinks, the bartender said that he will be open until 2 am. The guard insisted that we leave anyway so we asked if we could talk to his manager. The F&B MANAGER came with a second armed guard and again ordered us to leave the showroom and take our drinks elsewhere. we felt that he could have us physically kicked out of the premises so I told him that I will have to report this incident to his superiors. we are senior citizens, minorities and from out of town trying our best to enjoy the rest of our lives so we decided to leave and left our drinks at the bar instead of feeling unwanted and scared of these people. At our age, I don't think that we deserve to be maltreated, threatened and descriminated agains that way hence we left last vegas with a very bad experience that we have nevern into for more than 65 years now.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the dollar”
Reviews.Author: SIWST852
Reviews.Content: I enjoy staying here. It is not the Ritz but it is clean and comfortable (except for the pillows). For the price the hotel is very good . We got a coffee pot and conditioner that other strip hotels don't offer. They have a shuttle that takes you to the strip. The bathroom window opens a plus, but the bathroom door is a slider a negative if you are not alone. The room is also a bit dark The staff is always pleasant and the casino has some of the best pay-tables for VP. The cocktail service is also terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: backpackingpeople
Reviews.Content: The hotel value for money was incredible. The hotel was no Caesar's Palace don't get me wrong, but was perfectly adequate. We stayed in one of the rooms that had not been renovated, but even still the room was clean and tidy and the bathroom, although a little outdated, was perfectly fine also. The hotel was situated relatively close to 'The Strip', but walking was not necessary as the shuttle-bus was so convenient. Overall, a great budget option.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Sherry R
Reviews.Content: After my sister had us booked at a LV Strip hotel/casino and finding horrid accomodations, I contacted the hostess at Gold Coast, my favorite spot in LV. We were able to use comps for the Gold Coast's great rooms and promptly moved. We ate prime rib in the Cortez Restaurant one night, steak and lobster at TGIF the second night, and breakfast at the buffet. Oh, yes, we played all day at the Gold Coast (and into the night) where all of the staff is so friendly and courteous. The comps accumulated quickly, so we were able to use them frequently for food. We live in the midwest and enjoy our visits to LV and the Gold Coast. Have been visiting the Gold Coast since the 90's - our favorite home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Ten days away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Aligattor
Reviews.Content: and how magic was it? Fantastic!. Everything is huge in the States and it does take a lot of getting used to. After a good quick check in we were directed to a super clean room. A good price. Rooms serviced daily. One hitch. I love my coffee but could not find any I enjoyed in all Vegas. That was no problem as the rest was spot on. Meals are there in many of their restuarants that fit any pocket. Shuttle bus was great, on time and clean. Nice happy drivers. B Connected was interesting.To play with and gain discounts . Floor walkers/helpers/? they were all they should be. Sports bar was a mans place. T.V screens galore. All good All staff friendly and very helpful. Are we going again? Yes, next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to The Strip without the Hassle of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Kenownr
Reviews.Content: The Goldcoast is a great location just off the strip, but far enough away to avoid the "hassles" of the strip noise and congestion. This is a big plus for me as I go out to LAS to relax, play a bit on the slots and eat all the buffets I can find LOL. I've stayed at the Goldcoast many times and have always been treated by "ALL" the staff as if I was the biggest player in the house; even though I don't often play much higher than nickle or quarter slots. I play at several Boyd houses and always feel at least I get a fair shot at winning something. I've played many times on the strip and for the most part didn't do nearly as well as the Boyd properties. I've paid for a few trips, and went home almost broke a few trips, but at least I had a good time and felt I did have a fair shot at a good win. The hotel rooms are always clean at the "coast" and comfortable with reasonable rates and pretty darn good comps offered even though as I said, I'm certainly not the "whale" player you need to be at the big strip hotels. Breakfast buffet is good, and you club card will offer a nice discount. Lunch and dinners are priced reasonably and always enough to fill you up for another round at the tables, or slots LOL. Drinks are offered consistently while playing with very nice cocktail waitresses who are always courteous. Summary: I travel from Michigan at least 7 or 8 times a year to play in LAS and the Goldcoast, or if not available, one of the Boyd properties is always at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Good Gambling Bad”
Reviews.Author: onemoreshot163
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here five times over the years, rooms are super clean and the staff is very friendly. I had a very bad experience on my last visit, I had a winning day at the Craps table and apparently this is not allowed. The following day I was playing Craps and the Box man and Pit Boss applied pressure to me while I was shooting the dice. I have been playing Craps for years and know the game inside and out. However whatever I did it didn’t matter, the pressure continued. The atmosphere at the table was unprofessional and hostile. I had done nothing to justify this treatment except win money the previous day. For the remainder of my stay (4 days) I would not and did not gamble at the Gold Coast. I have sent four letters to the top executives of Gold Coast Casino/Boyd Gambling and after two weeks I have not received a response from the Boyd executives, if I do I will update this review. I do not want to allow the bad behavior of two employees to reflect on the entire Boyd Corporation. I do however expect a response from them along with an explanation and what actions if any Boyd might have taken. Would I stay at the Gold Coast Casino again?

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms at a great price”
Reviews.Author: NotLostJustWandering
Reviews.Content: It's off the strip on Flamingo, across the street from the Palms & the Rio. They have a free shuttle to the strip or you can take a cab. The rooms have all the basics and are clean. And it's an inexpensive place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vibe!”
Reviews.Author: GayTraveler2011
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my recent, first stay at the Gold Coast. I liked the off-Strip location and the smaller scale (by Las Vegas standards, at least) of the property. We had an updated room which was nicely decorated and reasonably priced. The bathroom however, had a non-locking, sliding door with gaps that did not afford sufficient privacy. The pool was appealing, the buffet a good value and the slots were on the looser side. We even tried the bowling alley which was a lot of fun. I plan to stay there again in my next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Yorkie017
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Gold Coast before and decided to stay again due to the value rooms. The check in was swift and we were advised that our room did not have the best view . The hotel was full however we were offered to change the following day. As we did not book for the view we were not initially bothered about moving however there was a plumbing issue with the room so we moved the following day. This was easy to do and reception was happy to change the room. The beds are large and comfortable. The room was clean and tidy. The food choice is varied but does not cater well for people like me with food allergies. TGI fridays failed completely only able to offer me one dish out of a menu containing about 50 items. The dish provided was bland and had no taste. There is obviously no skill in the kitchen and most of the food is pre-prepared(Avoid!!!!!!). The Cortez Room however was happy to provide a good meal and the service from Iris was second to none. The gaming halls felt quiter than normal and there were less cocktail waitresses available. Its nice to see more no smoking signs , pity its not all no smoking as coming from the UK we are now used to being able to go out without clothes smelling of stale smoke. Good that the Shuttle bus is available to the Orleans and the strip. All in all what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “good times at the gold coast”
Reviews.Author: cswift53
Reviews.Content: The Gold Coast is a great place to stay for a trip to Vegas. Rooms are very reasonable (cheap), nice and clean, and convenient without the confusion of the strip. Of course they make it easy to visit the strip by providing a free shuttle. Employees couldn't be nicer or more accommodating. And we loved breakfast at TGI Fridays! The hotel had everything we needed and you can always safely walk across the street for the wonderful buffet at Rio! They are very good to you at the Gold Coast!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: fyeolm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is dated but our room was excellent. Amazed at how cheap it was to stay there. Worth a visit for the food. Food of all nationalities on a help yourself basis with the waiting staff looking after you very well... topping up your coffee.juice constantly. Although this is not on the strip the hotel bus runs to and from the centre of the strip every ten minutes. Fantastic value for money ... would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable, quiet”
Reviews.Author: BrownDawg
Reviews.Content: Not a bad Las Vegas hotel. An older crowd and not as many tragically hip twenty-somethings as you see at hotels on the Strip. Room was quiet and bed OK but it had a motel feel about it and seemed dated.The rooms had popcorn ceilings and the hallways were dark with drop ceilings. Stayed there for a conference at the Rio because all conference-rate Rio rooms had been booked. It was a short walk between hotels, which was OK since the temperature was in the 80s and not the 90s or 100s like it had been for my other Vegastrips this year. Would I stay there again? Maybe, depending on where the particular conference or meeting was being held. .

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellerOregon
Reviews.Content: The Gold Coast was a pleasant surprise! While the front desk seemed under-staffed at times, the stay was fabulous. I was attending a conference at the Rio (next door) and didn't want to pay the Rio prices (and guests reviews weren't that good) A full service TGIFridays restaurant in the hotel, and the best value breakfast buffet, this hotel is the place to stay. The room was quiet (a plus in Las Vegas). The casino wasn't over-run with drunken revellers - a pleasant quiet atmosphere. The Palms is across the street (McDonalds, and more) - plus there is a free shuttle service that drops you on The Strip so you can explore. Afterwards, you can return to the peace and quiet (and a good night's sleep) of the Gold Coast. I would definitely stay here again when I am in Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Gold Coast Casino”
Reviews.Author: Blair B
Reviews.Content: The Gold Coast Casino is a great place to relax and have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Still good value.”
Reviews.Author: maryc82
Reviews.Content: It has been some years since we stayed here but we thought we would try the new rooms. The room although seeming smaller due to the remodelled bathroom was beautiful. Decoration and bed linens were top class. The new bathroom with fully slate tiled floor and waterfall shower is wonderful. It made us think seriously about staying longer at this hotel the next time we are in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, smelly & cheap”
Reviews.Author: Mommaforbes
Reviews.Content: I walked into the building and it smelled of stale cigarette smoke, and some strong and unnatural cinnamon air freshener. The casino was empty at noon (very odd) and there was only one food choice ( TGI Friday's-also closed). I had to go through a yucky service elevator to get to floor 1. The ceilings were low, dirty white popcorn style covered in a film of dirt and old smoke. The halls were dark. Carpet worn and dated. Upon entering the room- I saw a bed with cheap linens, a tv, and a window- which I opened...it looked right over a dirty roof, and didn't open. The bathroom had plastic, dark brown toilet and tub- complete with a soap film. I contacted the office, gave up my 1st nights renal amount- and canceled my reservation. I went across to the Rio- which has a lot to do, shows, an amazing pool, with rooms that are large and up to date. Although all of Vegas is really too smoke filled for my taste.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas off on the strip on the cheap!”
Reviews.Author: lynnthenurse
Reviews.Content: Gold Coast - known by some of the cab drivers as the "old Ghost" is located off the strip across from the Rio and the Palms.- two very fun properties within walking distance. If you want to venture to the strip the Gold Coast has a shuttle that will take you there. The Gold Coast is a smaller, older casino. But was very clean. All staff, from front desk, to buffet staff, to housekeeping were quite friendly and helpful. There are several restaurants, including TGI Fridays within the hotel property and a very good buffett with dinner at about 12 bucks. Rooms are clean, older, with darker colored sink and bath - but was just fine! When we went the price for a weeknight was only $39. I am a woman traveling alone and felt just fine being there by myself. I would definately stay there again if I wanted to go and save some money. Only slightly negative I found was the pool area is kinda small - so if big open pools are your thing this probably wouldn't work for you.

Reviews.Title: “brrrrrrr!”
Reviews.Author: keverina
Reviews.Content: stayed 5 nights,just about everything agreeable except the maid service,usually only half the room was cleaned .also didn't like the sub freezing temperature which the casino is kept at,brought 1 long sleeved shirt and had to wear it everyday.dealers and sportsbook employees were fine,really enjoyed the ping pang restaurant.as far as drinks don't be afraid to ask what specials are offered as the bartenders are not that forthcoming..

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: lordbarney
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gold Coast in October 2011. The rooms are a good size and the beds very comfortable. The Bathroom needs an update and is very small. The staff are very helpful and friendly with the marked exception of the Dealers and Croupiers who are rude and surly- which is shame because I rarely spent any money on the casino floor because of this. The other thing that lets the hotel down is the choice of food available- the buffet very average. TGI's was revolting. The exception was the Asian cuisine which was very good. But overall I enjoyed my stay here- mainly due to the service staff and the great value.

Reviews.Title: “Home”
Reviews.Author: barbara b
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying at the Gold Coast at least twice a year for about the last 10 years. We wouldn't stay anywhere else. The gaming is fair; the food is excellent and of good value; and the people treat you like a high roller - going that extra step to make you feel special. We have taken family and friends many times. If you feel you have to go to other casinos, there is a convient shuttle to the Orleans and the strip. You couldn't ask for better eats than the buffet, Ping Pang Pong, Noodles and TGIFridays and the Cortez Room rivals the best restraunts in Las Vegas. I always feel comfortable, safe, and at home when I am there.

Reviews.Title: “Great off strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daniel C
Reviews.Content: I visited the Gold Coast for a week in October 2011 and had a really good time. Bowling is 24/7 and $1 a game during discounted hours (you also get discounted shoes and beers), if you're really nice they'll give you 2 for 1 good for up to 3 games but I think we got lucky with these vouchers. The rooms were ok, perhaps the decor was a little tired and the shower/toilet area was TINY. In my room the aircon was very noisy but I was drunk so didn't notice much. Apparently you can upgrade to the newer rooms for $10 a night and these are supposed to be a lot better. As a whole the casino floor is average but I didn't expect much, the restaurants were generally below average but you can always visit the palms across the road. Me and my friend had a problem with the standard of service from croupiers which was the only thing that really let down the trip. I can even recall my friend saying that a croupier "Couldn't wait to quit his shift" and showed no enthusiasm at all; not quite Vegas standard. I would actually visit this hotel again as I had a good time. One more thing to note was that the security is really good here. One night I was stupid drunk and was requested to give my name and room number as well as showing my room key before proceeding to the lifts, another night my friend got locked out and was knocking on the door before security approached him. Finally there is no room safe but if you have a lot of money you can use a safe at the cashier free of charge- just a $100 deposit required.

Reviews.Title: “Value is golden”
Reviews.Author: Azvegas
Reviews.Content: Close to the Strip and across the street from the Palms. Midnight bowling $1.00 games and shoe rental. Cheap drinks and eats. The rooms are pretty good too with flatscreens and decent beds, despite the tiny bathroom. Lots to love, though sadly Boyd's poker room operation has shifted to just Orleans on this side of the strip. Can even enjoy the dollar dogs in the sportsbook during football. Not too shabby. Value for the dollar, the general store has fair prices too with discounts for Boyd's card. Kind of an eyesore exterior, gets better inside.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: chelsea r
Reviews.Content: first trip to vegas and we were just looking for something nice and not to expensive... and that was exactly what it was... it was typically an older crowd but we were mainly there to sleep so it worked

Reviews.Title: “Bowling Trip”
Reviews.Author: sherry s
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best trips we have ever had to Las Vegas (we have been coming to Las Vegas 3times a year for over 25 years). We had fun, relaxed and enjoyed our visit to Gold Coast. You know it has provided us with such a "comfort level". The people from the time I pull in to the desk clerks to the fresh clean and neat rooms to the people at the tables or the machines. There is a pit boss lady who has been there for all 25 years that I can remember and she see's me and say's "welcome back" that is so awesome to me. The food no matter where you eat is excellant. My husband goes to bed around 10-11 pm and I think nothing of playing until 4:30-5:30 am. When I am just getting in he is just waking up. This is what I mean by my "comfort level". We even brought my best friend and my husbands sister with us and we all felt the same. We had a ball.

Reviews.Title: “Double booked room”
Reviews.Author: melgede
Reviews.Content: In all my traveling experience throughout the years all over the world, this is the first time that I was given a room that was already being occupied by someone else. When we opened the door, we saw stuff on the beds and the luggages of the people who were using the room. Good thing, there was no one in the room or it would have been embarassing and awkward for all of us. This should never happen in any hotel. This is also a serious security issue! When we complained to the front desk, they said that the people checked out through the TV and so it did not register in their system. What ever the reason is, this should have NOT happened. There is nothing outstanding about this hotel. It's a regular, basic, and hotel with a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Coast "Disapointing"”
Reviews.Author: Garydreamz
Reviews.Content: Spent two comped nights at Gold Coast. First, and last trip there. Generally like the Boyd properties just fine, but was disappointed with Gold Coast. Check in at 2 AM was fine. Room looked exactly like the pictures at Vegascasinoinfo.com. Room was clean and bed was very comfortable. Flat screen TV had poor picture. Bathroom was strange. Sliding door didn’t really close tightly. Everything in one room. No tub, shower only, with half a door. I have never seen this before in my life. It’s like half the sliding door is missing. Impossible to get the shower area really warm because you lose all the heat to the rest of the bathroom. I like a very hot shower and like to dry off in the hot shower. Just very different than I am used to. View was of an old apartment complex. There is a window in the bathroom, I have no idea why. I did open it and thought it was going to fall out. The frame was rusted out and I had a heck of a time getting it closed again. Very long halls. If you have any difficulty with walking long distances I would definitely mention this when making reservation. Not impressed with the casino. We play a lot of video poker and they have lots of VP machines, however they are generally older with buttons that stick or touch screens that don’t work very well. Almost all were “fuzzy.” Only ate there once, late at night. Chinese restaurant has good reputation, and food looked really good, but was a little late, (or early) for Chinese for me. Only other late night option was TGIF. Not a fan to begin with, and more so now. Eggs were not properly prepared, hash browns were dry and over coked, toast was burned and hamburger patty was OK. A place this big needs a Café type late night option other than TGIF in my humble opinion. The casino was very busy on Saturday night, but it seemed like there were lots of angry folks looking for trouble there as well. I was comped so I can’t say I feel I was overcharged, however in the future given an option, I will definitely chose another Boyd property. Much prefer Main Street Station. Its not really bad, just disappointing. I expected better. All things considered I would give Gold Coast an overall grade of C-.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Rosie1220
Reviews.Content: Our group of friends have stayed at the Gold Coast for the past several years and we recently returned from our trip in September. The rooms are clean and spacious and everyone from the front desk to the housekeeping staff were courteous and friendly and is the main reason we keep returning. We like the proximity to the Rio and the Palms, and the GC shuttle is very convenient to the Strip, which we took advantage of every day. It doesn't have the glitz and glitter of some of the newer hotels on the Strip, but if you want good value for your money, a variety of restaurants, and the feeling of an old friend, the Gold Coast is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate and convenient”
Reviews.Author: PBJW1960
Reviews.Content: Although the gold coast is a little dated I received a warm welcome at midnight and the staff were helpful and considerate. My room on the 5th floor was clean and there was a coffee maker which is an obsolute must for me... Breakfast at TGI Friday's was very good and reasonably priced.... my only gripe was the $43 charge for a 5 minute international call to UK from my room to report my mobile phone missing.... There is a shuttle to the strip which runs every 30 mins, you can also walk across the road to RIO or Palms and get a shuttle there, or a cab is about $10 plus tip... The casino at gold coast is ok... they have $5 tables for black jack and poker and a couple of roulette tables... Don't know about value for money as the room rate was part of a flight and room package that didn't break out the individual costs.... however my son and his friend paid $44 per weekday night for their room which for them was $22 per night each so not bad value really.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Sharon S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gold Coast to attend a nearby conference. The rates were low and so were our expections, but we were actually quite impressed with the hotel, casino and restaurants. TGIFridays was a great breakfast place and Ping Pang Pong is a very good place to get authentic Chinese food. The hotel rooms are clean and the staff is friendly. We would definitely stay at the Gold Coast again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: stargazer008
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times. I enjoy the place for the value. Although, the buffet is not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: missmattie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days, 4 nights at the end of October 2010 and this was the first time staying here. We chose to stay here because my parents had a high school reunion to attend in the hotel. We have previously stayed in hotels on the strip. You can tell the hotel is old as soon as you walk in because it has a stale smell to it. The front desk staff was 'okay'. Certain people were definitely nicer than others. The valet guys were very friendly though. It looked like they were in the process of renovating because some of the carpets & wallpaper on certain floors looked newer than others. Also the pictures of the rooms on the website were definitely of rooms that had been renovated because our room did not look like them. I like that at night there is a security guard checking for room cards by the elevators to make sure not just anyone can access the rooms. The hotel is just off the strip next to Rio and across from the Palms so it's only a 2 minute drive (maybe 15 min walk) to the strip. It's great if you want to see Vegas on a budget because you're still close enough to get to all the attractions quite easily. Room Review (king size bed) - nothing special, comfortable for the price we paid ($38/night). - no duvet or comforter, just a couple blankets (a top sheet, a regular blanket and a polyester coverlet like the kind you might expect in an old hotel) - washroom was REALLY SMALL. The sink is actually just outside the toilet/shower/tub room. - there is only enough room for one person to stand infront of the toilet, so changing in the washroom is very tight - the tub/shower was old. In my parents room, the nob to release the plug for the drain actually got stuck and I had to use some muscle to open it up. - water pressure was weak and it was dark in the shower because the only light was above the toilet. - staff did a good job keeping the room clean Casino/Amenities: - the casino was nice. I don't gamble much but played a few slot machines and it was never packed to the point where I couldn't find a machine to play on. - there is live entertainment near the buffet - the buffet isn't spectacular but when you're just hungry and you're with a bunch of people, it was a great option for instant food. I believe it was around $14 for dinner. - there is a TGIFridays on the main floor near the exit to the pool, as well as a convenience store and Cafe - the pool & hot tub were okay. The pool isn't gigantic but it wasn't busy when we were there so we only had to share it with a few other people Again, this wasn't a fancy hotel but if you just want to get away and don't anticipate spending a lot of time in the hotel, then this would be a good option. This is also a good option if you have kids because it's a really relaxed environment and the hotel's smaller size (in comparison to other hotels on the strip) makes it easy to get your kids from the room to the pool to the buffet or to the car without really worrying about getting lost or separated.

Reviews.Title: “the alternative choice”
Reviews.Author: joedi2
Reviews.Content: i choose the goldcoast again for a short trip to vegas for presentation at unlv. located in the 2nd row of casinos/casino hotels the gold coast is within the focus of the us-people. my people (germans) or other european can not be seen so often. the room was booked directly using the hotel webside. i took the kingsize room for 37 dollar and the room was exactly as described. everything works well, looks fine etc. ------------------------- whats should be known from gold coast: - wifi is not inlcuded and must be booked additionally by using tv in situ. works nice, fast, and well. - breakfast is not included but can be arranged easily at the buffet in the casino. from the elevator to the casino, keep/turn right go to the ende of the casino. the all you can eat buffet cost 7.99 person (one dollar less when you have a gamers card (i never game, so ... no problem, i save more than one dollar by not gaming)). - the room with the view to the street can not be recommended especially not at the lower floors, they are located close to the ventilatio of the casino (at the 2nd floor). choose the rooms back with view to parking) - parking: use the parking place behind the hotel, here the employees are parking (> safer). - the personal was friendly. general comment: perfect place in vegas, easy access to I15, to flamingo (from where you can easily go to unlv parking area (eng. building).

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are very well kept and everyone is very friendly”
Reviews.Author: bossman0216
Reviews.Content: Wife and I decided to stay at Gold Coast this trip.The service was great at not only the casino/hotel,but at all resturants we went to.Have a little something for everyone,even if you just want to go bowling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel when you get tired of the "Tourists" on the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: mvmf1973
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been vacationing in Las Vegas since 1980. We originally stayed at all the overpriced touristy Hotels on the Strip, then we found the Gold Coast. Now the only Hotel we stay at is the Gold Coast. They have everything we want, several great restaurants,Bingo( in a Huge!! Bingo Hall all day),Tons of the new style slots,table games,free shuttle service buses Etc. The employee's are extremely pleasant, and are always very happy to help you in any way..This casino has more of a real Las Vegas "Feel" to it ,and you'll meet a lot of Vegas "locals" here,they know a good thing when they see it. The rooms are on the smaller side,but that never bothers us,because we are hardly ever in our room. The Hotel is next door and a very short walk to the Rio and the Palms. Give the Gold Coast a try,and you might become a regular guest like my wife and I.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade Me!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nic1kio3
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the new renovated room. The price was about $38 with taxes per night. Stayed only one night. The room is very small. Two full beds. I need two Queen beds. I probably would not pay to stay here again!!! Valet is slow too!!! I like the blackjack tables!!!

Reviews.Title: “Winner Winner, Chinese Dinner”
Reviews.Author: weemic
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed a two night comped stay at the Gold Coast on August 28 and 29. Checked in by clerk who was very friendly and helpful. Asked me if I wanted high or low, near elevators, etc.. She put me in room 738 near an elevator. Room had been reno'd. It reminded me of other Boyd properties. I had a view to the north. Could see Wynn and the Strat. I was very happy with my room. Bed was comfortable. Flat screen with lots of channels. Coffee maker. Bathroom wasn't huge but good enough for one or two people and it had a window in the shower that you can open up. Same as I have seen at the Orleans and Bills. I needed to grab something to eat that night so I tried Ping Pang Pong. Good service, very efficient. Friendly and helpful staff. I had the Chinese Brisket stew which is one of my favorite dishes. A bowl of white rice and Chinese tea and I was ready to play. Had breakfast next morning in the buffet and it was cheap, and basic. Decent omelettes and bacon, sausage etc. After a day of play I came back to the GC to try the Noodle Exchange. Had fun cooking my own Seafood Hot Pot. Had a look at the pool area and it seemed small. Didn't try it out. Too hot that day in Vegas. My rental car said it was 115! I am not a huge fan of the GC casino. Dealers aren't the friendliest. Neither are the Pit Crews. They don't seem to like where their careers have landed them. But I came out ahead by a couple of hundred bucks. Overall I had a great stay. Would I return? You betcha. Even if I wasn't comped it would make my short list. Boyd has been good to me. The only problem I had at the GC hotel was that there was no in room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay. Buffet restaurant great value on weekdays.”
Reviews.Author: i_yac
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gold Coast while attending DEFCON at the nearby Rio. It was a decent stay. The best part of it was that the buffet restaurant off the casino floor was great value on weekdays. On the weekend, they increase the breakfast/lunch price to almost double and call it brunch with almost no change of content. Two other negatives about the room: 1) the shower was dark if showering at night or before sunrise; 2) no safe in the room. The "business center" was pretty lame as well as it was only a PC (with minimum time purchase) and a photocopier/fax that you feed quarters into.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous prices, great hotel - super value for a couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: npcommunications
Reviews.Content: Two couples went to Vegas in October 2010. We have stayed at the Monte Carlo, Mandalay Bay, Gold Coast, Treasure Island, Harrah's and MGM in the past. We weren't sure about staying at this hotel because it was slightly off the strip and it was so cheap we thought it must not be very nice. We booked 4 nights in Vegas: 2 nights at the Gold Coast and 2 nights at the Mirage. Got great deals at both hotels. The Gold Coast was fabulous. Very clean, modern rooms. VERY friendly staff and customer service. It's a small casino, but well organized and fun! Great drink service. Bus takes you out to the strip for free....and also to sister hotel the Orleans. We spent an evening at the Orleans and loved it too! Loved having the TGIFriday's restaurant in the hotel and we were amazed at the size of the bowling alley - it was way cool. We would definitely go back to the Gold Coast and stay the full 4-5 days there. Mirage was super nice, but for the price - Gold Coast rocked!

Reviews.Title: “Love to go there when I am in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CWolf1096
Reviews.Content: The hotel decor is old. I have been there numerous times and I haven't won once from gambling there yet. But I like it there and I go there each time I am in Vegas. Why? The service is excellent: very friendly staff and great customer service. The comp is good too. The first time I played there they comp-ed me 20 dollars for dinner. Food is surprisingly good there. Ping Pang Pong serves authentic Chinese dishes and the food is delicious! Their prices are as good as in any restaurant in Chinatown. They also have Dim Sum. The Noodle exchange has the best mini hot pot that I have ever had. I don't know what they put in the broth but it's fantastic! If you like shabu hotpot dinner, it is one not to be missed! TGI Friday is a 24 hour operation and their steak and lobster dinner is only 13 dollars and change. However, I think you can only get that price before 6pm. The room looked old but comfortable.
