We could use the pool and the gym for free. Live Latin (Salsa) band plays on Saturday night. 10 dollars admission includes a free drink. Sunday you can go social dancing upstairs on the second floor. Gaming is 5 dollars a bet. Lots of play time for the money. All in all, it's bargain going there and I always have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: etlive
Reviews.Content: Hotel was not the most beautiful but everything was convenient. Buses to the strip, chinese food just like home, people were extremely nice The slots were plentiful and of great variety If you do not like crowds, this is a nice place to be and close enough to actually see the strip at night.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain, great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: svwriter2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights while my spouse attended a computer hackers convention next door at the Rio. The hotel was clean, the room had european bedding and a flat screen tv, and a view of the Luxor. TGIFridays was inexpensive and good, the buffet was excellent at breakfast and lunch, and best of all the price was right: $200 total for Thurs, Fri, and Sat nights. I loved being off the Strip and away from the hordes of tourists. Maybe not for the Young and Restless but just fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: 808choosytraveler
Reviews.Content: I would give this place 1 star if not for the dealers being so nice. The front desk person was terrible with a disgruntled attitude and no customer service skills. Our family of 5 arrived on a Monday evening and was told that they had canceled our reservation for 2 rooms - I had the printed confirmation in my hand to show the front desk person. She told me they had no more rooms available - unbelievable! The place was empty as this was a Monday night at an off the strip hotel. When I expressed my displeasure and wanted to see a manager, she said that no manager was available until the next morning - unbelievable! When I asked her what my options were, she said the best that she could do was give me 1 non-smoking room and 1 smoking room, on different floors - she told me earlier no more rooms were available. When I asked if she had rooms on the same floor, she became agitated and told me that is the best she could do and that my choice was to take it or go somewhere else - I took it because we had 2 tired children with us after a long plane ride. To her credit, she told me she would honor the room price on my confirmation. Guess what, when I went to check-out, the price was higher than my confirmed price - so another round of challenges to get it right. Good things about the hotel - the dealers are friendly and the Chinese restaurant Ping Pang Pong has decent food for Vegas. Stay at the Orleans or downtown rather than here if you want to stay off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Find”
Reviews.Author: skitahoe46
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Gold Coast for 2 days in June. We were met with a warm greeting at check in and this seemed to carry through the entire stay. The pool was not overly large but very nice. The prices of refreshments at the pool were very reasonable. The food at the buffet was good and once again the price was outstanding. I would recommend the Gold Coast to anyone who wants to get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. They do run their own shuttles to the strip just in case you do want to wander on over. The room was very clean and modern the bathroom was adequate although no tub but a nice walk in shower.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: 0zero0
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and staff was helpful. I checked 4 hours before check-in time and the front desk did not mind at all, no extra charges - they gave me my keys and I was off to my room. We stayed for three nights in a standard room, the cleaning staff was friendly and efficient. The bathroom in the standard room is smaller than most other hotels - but very clean, even had ironing board with a top quality iron. We booked one of the hotels summer specials from their website which came to 31$ per night after taxes. I was happy to find no surprises, no hidden charges and no mishaps. This hotel has clean quiet rooms, friendly staff and great prices with no surprises. This is exactly what i want in a hotel. Other notes: ample self parking that is close to doors and valet service when you don't feel like walking 20 yards to self park. If you want fancy rooms with bigger bathrooms go for the premiere rooms around 10$ more per night.

Reviews.Title: “Far from the strip...rooms were nice...casino dirty”
Reviews.Author: wineshding
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip with a 'FREE TRIP TO VEGAS' promotion and it turned out to be ok. The actual casino is a bit sketchy, with an older crowd and very smokey. Only book a premium room as it was newly renovated and comfortable. I don't know what the older rooms are like but have heard back things. Go to the Asian restaurants downstairs as the food was cheap and delicious. Overall, a good cheap trip but not luxury. There is a free shuttle to the strip but it was always full and you had to wait 30 minutes each time for the next one so we ended up cabbing. Service was not the most friendly either. And the internet is very expensive in the rooms, 12.99 for 24-hours, I think we should have had free wi-fi. They also did not clean our room on the first day for some reason.

Reviews.Title: “hotel ok food service lousy”
Reviews.Author: dbkeybrd
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is not bad for the price you pay. The room was in the older section but was clean and bed was comfortable. Only complaint is the small bathroom. The casino was not as good as in the past visits. Food service was lousy all the way around. Only have the options of TGIF's, The Cortez Room - which was closed for renovations, the buffet and Katies Korner Deli. Buffet was good. TGIF's and Katies Korner terrible. Katies Korner has 3 sandwiches on the menu for all the time plus a daily special each Can't have the type of sandwich on the daily special unless it is actually the day and of the 3 on the regular menu only 2 are available now. Ordered a salad with Italian dressing and after paying was told "Oh I forgot we only have ranch or thousand island." Server had to keep asking another person do we have this still? Don't know how they stay in business. . Would I stay here again, maybe. Would I eat anywhere in the hotel again, not likely unless it was the buffet. Do have to say the prime rib at the buffet was excellent. Very well seasoned and very tender. Have spent a lot of time at this hotel over the past 10 years and this is the first time I have been so disappointed in the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great near strip value”
Reviews.Author: grayhorse89
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my recent stay here. We arrived on an early flight before 11 AM but they checked us in immediately and gave us our rooms - unlike the Strip hotels that we usually stay at. The rooms are small but in good repair - even the non upgraded rooms. Water pressure was great, housekeeping was good. The in room coffee maker made it worth the $3 ( cheap ) resort fee for me. No complaints whatsoever. A great place to stay if you want to save a few bucks. A very short walk across to the Palms and also the Rio. The free shuttles to the strip ( Bill's ) were great if you had the time to wait for them ( 20 - 25 minutes sometimes ) . Its not a place for the pool set, the clubbers etc and thats a good thing. Self parking is a snap in their lot. They have a big selection of liquor at the sundry shop and the prices there are lower than I can purchase in a store here at home ! The casino was quiet and sedate - if that is what you want and they had good video poker pay tables and a lot of $5 tables. One of the few places with bingo.

Reviews.Title: “Caution! Two Unexpected Surprises”
Reviews.Author: hirunningman
Reviews.Content: Gold Coast is a value oriented hotel, off the strip and adjacent to the Rio. The accomodations were fine. We booked a renovated room which, frankly, seemed better on the internet than in person. It was a fine room, but nothing special. Both my wife and I felt that the $$ value of the hotel was in line with physical plant. We used the fitness room repeatedly on our visit and we found it uncrowded with working equipment. The casino was fine. We passed on most of the restaurants but the coffee shop served Starbucks coffee and had nice breakfast items. All in all, a good value for the $$. We had two surprises that would make us think twice about booking here again, however. The first was on the second day. My wife and I returned to our room at about 5pm to find ourselves locked out of our room. I left my wife, alone and with bags of shopping, at the door to the room while I returned to the front desk. According to the desk personnel, we had been checked out automatically after a single night, even though our reservation was for 6 nights! Scary! The desk clerk offered to recheck us in, but at a high rate than I had reserved the original room at. I discussed the matter with him and I agreed to go get the printed copy of my original booked rates in order to have the rates adjusted. The important point I want other Tripadvisor customers to take from this is that it is good to print this out and have it if you need it. What was strange was that all of our things had not been touched, which surprised me given that we had been "checked out". The desk clerk insisted that we had been checked in for only 1 night, but I distinctly remember signing an electronic acknowledge for all six nights the day before. It made both my wife and I a bit nervous about our stay and the security of our room. The desk staff was polite and helpful, but not illuminating (regarding the problem) except to say that we had been checked out early, perhaps by mistake. It wasn't reassuring in the least. The second issue occured on the 4th night of our stay. We received a notice that the hotel would be under construction on our 5th and 6th days and that there would likely be noise from tile being removed in other suites. This was something of a "last straw", as we had planned to spend these days chilling out in the room and at the hotel. My wife and I are both readers and this would have been very disturbing. Luckily, the hotel had no problem with us checking out early as a result of the notice and we found another hotel that had the promise of more serene environs. We would consider staying here again, but both incidents left us feeling like we would risk little in trying other places.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a visit and lower table minimums”
Reviews.Author: StevoRC
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay here, but drove from another hotel just to check out the casino and amenities. The table gaming area is decent with many "lower than the strip" minimums as expected. Overall, the casino was large and roomy unlike the downtown casinos. They even had a Keno parlor if you're into playing Keno. If our luck at the tables were down, we would have gone bowling. We didn't eat here but noticed the Ping Pang Pong had Asian servers pushing dim sum carts during lunch. It looked delicious! Not sure if I would stay here, but would definately return to play and eat. Located next to the Rio.

Reviews.Title: “Descent place to stay near the strip at an excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: BSpeaker
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Free shuttle to the strip from 8am-12am. - Free parking (covered and uncovered). - Walking distance to trip (under 1 mile) if interested. - Refrigerator in the suite. - 24-hour restaurant on site (TGI Friday's) - Expedia rate around $30+. - $3 patron fee per day (maybe a negative). Cons: - Smoke smell throughout the facility (but our room smelled fine). - Must go through the casino to get to the hotel (not best for families or non-gamblers). - Older property in need of updates (ask for a new room on the remodeled floors for $10 more). - Indoor smoking allowed in the casino. - No microwave. - Not cleaned in some areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: dstampp
Reviews.Content: After reading the bad reviews, I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel. Yes it is an older hotel and needs a little remodeling, but it is not as bad as some of the other reviews. We booked one of the newly upgraded rooms and it was beautiful! They have a beautiful walk-in, tiled shower and the bed was very comfortable! The housekeeping staff did a good job keeping the room clean and there were always fresh linens on the bed everyday. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is located off the strip which we actually preferred. It was a little more quiet and it was not as hectic as the strip. Although, there is a free shuttle at the Gold Coast that will take you to and from the strip. We ate at the buffet twice, once for dinner and once for breakfast. The dinner buffet was just ok, but the breakfast was wonderful and a great price as well. Overall, it was a nice place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Grendilon
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Vegas for many years and I've never stayed in a worse place. The room smelled like mold. There was mildew in the shower and the bathroom floor. There was no shower door. The furniture was broken, battered and falling apart. There was a big pink vomit stain on the carpet between the beds. Maid service was exceptionally poor. They barely touched the room when they came to "clean" it. The breakfast buffet was lovely though, and a great value at $7.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise Off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: SonyaStew
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Gold Coast, perfectly located between The Palms & Rio. We booked one of their newly renovated rooms and was pleasantly surprised by the quality and service, the beds were heaven....well the $3 patron shots didn't hurt. I only ate at the Friday, which is the perfect drunk dinner...but other than that don't go for the food eat next door at the Rio. The customer service was excellent, the staff was beyond friendly and reliable. (The check in agent even gave is a list of non-strip/local restaurants that were all GREAT) Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Bait & Switch Rooms”
Reviews.Author: veasaigon
Reviews.Content: When we checked in on this hotel last June 3, we were told that they have ran out of single king rooms so we are being "upgraded" to a suite room (room 1070) at no extra charge. Sweet ha? What the front desk did not tell us is that the suite room is a smoking bed room! We made the reservation on December 2010 specifying that we need a non-smoking room and we even agreed to be charged one night to guarantee the room. Where is the guarantee from them? The room is big no doubt but it reels with cigarette smell all over and it might have triggers my asthma attack or something. I do not whether the mildew in the bathroom or the smell but it me a week after to recover from that that horrible stay. What makes it more insulting is that when we complained to the desk, all we got is "that is the only room we have": no sorry, no apology, no nothing. Bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Off-Strip Value If You Get An Upgraded Room”
Reviews.Author: Travelsavvy888
Reviews.Content: This is an older property so you won't get the glitz of Vegas Strip hotels. If you want an upscale experience, get an upgraded room for just a few extra bucks (they are better than standard rooms). Check out can be busy on weekends. The breakfast buffet is predictable but an excellent value for what you get. Food is fresh and choices are plentiful for $5.99 with a club card discount. If you want a high-protein start to your day while saving some cash, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: julio942
Reviews.Content: I booked through a wholesaler because it was among the cheapest rates for the weekend I was there, so I didn't expect much. But I was pleasantly surprised! The Gold Coast is off of the strip and our room didn't have a spectacular view, but it was quite large--large enough even to comfortably fit a rollaway bed in a room with 2 doubles. Guest services was helpful and the attendant who checked me in was very informative (I think her name was Jane?). We didn't spend much time at the hotel, but it was a nice place to come home to at the end of the night. My one complaint is that the casino staff itself was not the friendlist. The only way to learn a game at this casino was to play, whereas at other places on the Strip, idle employees were happy to help until a potential customer arrived. I'd recommend staying at the Gold Coast, but not gambling there.

Reviews.Title: “A super place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: yaqui60750
Reviews.Content: Check the morning buffet for freshnes, savory morsels, and friendly, courteous service. The first taste of coffee will make a comebacker every morning. Relax and reminice with your spouse or friend until you are ready to amble over to the casino for a little action. You may find more action than wanted at the roulettes or 21 tables. Stay and enjoy the nice rooms, ready for a restful night. All in all the Gold Coast will be my casino from now on. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for the Vegas glitz, then go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: FlyStayEat
Reviews.Content: My group and I travel almost yearly to Las Vegas for the Kentucky Derby weekend. We've stayed almost everywhere, but normally attend the Derby party at the Gold Coast so we decided to give it a whirl this time. The price is great (as low as $44 per night) and the strip is walking distance, but it's along a busy street. I wouldn't walk it alone at night. Spent a lot of time at Caesar's since this is the first casino you reach on the walk. Oh, the shuttle is just too much trouble - sharing with the Orleans. We never could get everyone on a shuttle. You do have pretty easy access to the Palms and Rio but I did miss being in the middle of it all. The pool is ok and we got no hassle bringing in our own cooler of drinks. Buffet is cheap and decent for breakfast. Starbucks coffee bar. Rooms - weird rooms. The bathroom door gives little privacy - something to think about if you're traveling with friends. Room door had a tendency to pop open if not bolted. No room safe - felt bad leaving computers, iPads, cash, purse, in the room while cleaning crew was there. Had to call housekeeping at 5:30 one evening because our room got skipped. Clientele - mixed bag. Witnessed a domestic altercation which led to a male guest take off his pants and underwear and defecate outside the hotel. Really, yes. I could have done without this visual burned into my mind. I hate to judge, but there were some trashy folks at the Gold Coast.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay”
Reviews.Author: AmanteDeViagens
Reviews.Content: Gold Coast is an old hotel that needs serious work. For the price you pay it is just OK. Front desk is not helpful at all. I am not sure if they expect tips, which I am not used to give. I think I already pay enough for the hotel room. The beds are very uncomfortable. Buffet is cheap, but you get what you pay. Casino stinks smoke very badly. And that's not because there were too many people. It is just because the ventilation system needs some work. Below 4th floor you have a chance to get a big wall as a view.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: brunswick174
Reviews.Content: stayed here on 26 march to 31, had standard room smoking on the 9th floor,the room was very clean & tidy but tired & very dull, the bathroom was somthing else, just a one piece very worn green horrible discusting looking contraption, staff were very nice and the buffet was fantastic,we signed up to b connect card and you get a discount on the food at buffet,casino was very bright and clean with lots of restaurents around,prices are very good for this hotel we were pleased overall with everything except the bathroom/shower but you only sleep there so we were ok with this.pool was very small but clean and tidy, also good security around the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Laid-back casino, odd room design, good location, window opens..”
Reviews.Author: dullnever
Reviews.Content: I liked the casino a lot - especially the sports room. It's busy, but not to the point of crowded and deafening like the Bellagio or Wynn. The room was about a city block from the elevator - when making a reservation, best to request something closer. The dingy long hall has ghastly dim green lighting and a very low ceiling - I was really worried on approach to the room. The room had been redecorated, no doubt by somebody's stylish but clueless niece. Sort of IKEA design. It looked nice, but had limited practicality. The most obnoxious item was the door to the bathroom - basically a pocket door without a pocket hung outside the frame. It afforded little privacy, with 1-2" gaps on either end. I think a senior would have some difficulty grasping the indentation (no handle) to open and close this unwieldy door at all. The nightstand lamps were very low with broad bases, leaving about 10 square inches for your watch and water bottle on the table surface. Lighting was low - too low to really apply makeup in the bathroom. Otherwise, the window opened, which was great and rare. The king bed and bedding was extremely nice. Nice big LCD TV. Self-parking was free, ample, and convenient. You can walk to the Strip if you are ambitious - it's over a mile, and there is a pedestrian walkway. I found out that I enjoyed being off the crazy Strip, so I would consider staying at the Gold Coast again.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectly pleased and will definetly come back!”
Reviews.Author: LoveLasVegas0312
Reviews.Content: We received complimentary rooms at the Gold Coast, Las Vegas. We had never stayed there, so I read some of the reviews and figured I' ll be my own judge. Yes it is an older hotel but it is very nicely remodeled. It didn't smell of smoke. The restaurants are great and great prices. The room was small but who needs a big room when your not there to stay in the room. It was clean with a flat screen TV. The hotel parking is super convenient and easy to get too. I really enjoyed my stay and I hope to be back soon. Good Job Gold Coast.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest rip off on the strip”
Reviews.Author: rolstone1
Reviews.Content: No coffee offerred for their guests, you have to leave your room, walk for approx. 5 min. to nearest coffee shop, price for 2 coffees in am was $6. No free drinks offerred to you while you gamble, at one point while we were playing $1 slots at the bar and had ordered 2 drinks thinking they would be complimentary, the bartender told us we would have to gamble at least $20 worth to get a comp drink. The price of our 2 drinks: $15.50! The room is tidy, but has not been dusted for a long time. The price of 2 cheeseburgers with one plate of fries and 2 ice teas in their greasy spoon restaurant: $46!!!! When I asked why they did not have coffee makers in the rooms I was told it was because there are many rooms so it would be a fire hazard.....yet they have smoking rooms???!! There is a $20 per day extra charge on your room. We booked our room for 4 nights and had an extra $90 (20/day + tax) to be able to use the pool and internet! whether you want to or not! most of the staff have attitudes.

Reviews.Title: “3.5 out of 5!!”
Reviews.Author: airbrush101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the GC for 2-nights on January 22nd, both nights were comped. I really like the GC, good food options & great gambling!! Yes, it is weird having no door in the shower, but it's not my floor that's getting wet!! I just put extra towels on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Stay”
Reviews.Author: mersimbo
Reviews.Content: My wife was on a cruise with her mother and sister so I got to meet a friend in Vegas. I don't smoke but I always stay on the nineth floor. Rooms are clean and quiet. My friend and I had no problems with bed-bugs, I checked closely. The table crews were friendly, as usual, and the buffet had some good choices. Only stayed two days this time but I always enjoy talking with some of the locals I see each trip. If you treat them right, they'll treat you right. Had some pretty good luck at the tables. I'm not a big bettor but I enjoy the action. Sign up for the players card and take advantage of the promotions. My wife and I will probably come back in the fall for a few days longer. The Gold Coast is NOT the Ritz but the value is there. It depends what you want from the experience of Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “No shower door? Really?!”
Reviews.Author: Admiral21
Reviews.Content: In all my hotel stays in my life, this is the first time where the shower did not have a door! The thing is, it is designed that way. It had a glass half door, but that's it. Needless to say, water landed outside the shower and onto the bathroom floor. There was not much furniture in the room either. Just a small desk with two chairs. Disappointing, considering that I booked a Premium room. Bottom line...I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Alert”
Reviews.Author: christinla
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 4th floor. Never have had a 'bed bug' experience prior, so I was unaware that I was being bitten by them until I went to my physician upon returning home. I thought I had had an allergic reaction to the chemicals in their water, laundry detergent or perhaps even something I ate. My arms & legs were covered in a red rash coupled with small welts. The MD said it was the distictive linear pattern of bite marks that indicated the bed bug as being the culprit. I'm so itchy!! While I appreciated the kind professional staff, I can't say I will return to this establishment for fear of a repeat experience. I truly hope that those bugs in Vegas stayed in Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “great value to beat strip prices”
Reviews.Author: KENCORRALEJO
Reviews.Content: this is our second stay in the gold coast.The breakfast buffet offers a wonderful choice for7dollars.the other resteraunts are also good value .Each month a bottled beer is on offer ,during our stay it was heiniken at 2 dollars which must be the best price in vegas.The shuttle bus is available to the strip and is very reliable.We have stayed in most of the vegas hotels and would say not only is this hotel value for money it also very friendly and makes a pleasant change from the huge strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “So sad, the Gold Coast has really gone downhill...”
Reviews.Author: RodeoFoto
Reviews.Content: I had pretty high expectations for the Gold Coast, since the last time I stayed at the hotel was three years ago. Check in was a fiasco. The fellow was friendly enough, however I asked him three times to confirm I had a NS, King Size bed room. I got to the room - it was two beds. Back to the desk, and he said they can't confirm what kind of room you get if you book online. He also said they were overbooked and had no rooms left. Finally I got a King Size bed in a handicapped room. Why did I have to beg to get the room I purchased? The fellow in the line up next to me had prebooked a premium room - NS. All they had left were smoking rooms in premium or he had to take a standard room. I have never seen such confusion at check in. I walk to my room, and there is litter all down the hallway. Is this the ghetto now? So sad. I didn't find the staff very friendly. So different then the last time I was the Gold Coast where I felt everyone went out of your way to make sure you were enjoying your stay. The last night I stayed was a Friday night. There was alot of noise in the hotel hallways and stairwells. Very hard to sleep. The room I had was old and very run down. The shower didn't work well and I think the TV had 10 channels? The maid service was excellent. The price on the drinks has gone up to $5 and I had a hamburger and fries and it was $10. Vegas is not the deal it used to be unless you eat between 12:00 am and 5:00 am.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Coast Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: larrybpdg
Reviews.Content: The Gold Coast Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas is an OK place for the budget minded traveler. HOwever, is need to have some work done. Our room did not have a door leading to the bathroom, only and interior door to the camode. The carpet needs replacing. Otherwise, it is OK for a single night, but don't expect the same conditions as the other Coast Hotels, i.e., The Orleans and Suncoast.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and bowl”
Reviews.Author: fnrtraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our way to St. George Utah for Thanksgiving and decided to spend a night at the Gold Coast to take advantage of their 70 lane bowling center. I had very low expectations since this is a "locals" kind of hotel located a half mile off of the strip. We were completely blown away by the room decor, upkeep, ease of parking and check-in, and of course the Bowling Center. I reserved a Premium King room and it was waiting for us upon arrival. The front desk help was polite and efficient. The room decor was modern, beautiful, and completely functional. The shower even had a window in it that opened to the outside, letting all of the steam out without the usual noisy fan. We loved the bowling center, which we used upon arrival and again the next morning before we checked out. We ate breakfast in the TGI Fridays, which was just fine. All of this for the unbelievable rate of $39.00 plus tax. I would love to spend a few days here and explore Chinatown, which is very close. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for an affordable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Bob538
Reviews.Content: After several stays at another Boyd property, I chose the Gold Coast based on location, price, and the restaurants. I would defiantly return on a future stay. Check in was fast and efficient. I receive a renovated room even though I believe I booked a standard. The room was clean. Nothing fancy, just your basic room with a flat screen tv. On my first day, Saturday, one of the elevators was broken, and there seemed to be a crowd for the elevators all day. I attribute this to many people checking in/out on Saturday. By the next morning the broken elevator was fixed and there were no more crowds. The Noodle exchange is a great quick meal, and Friday’s is open 24 hours, and has $6 appetizers after midnight. Lots of low limit gaming with better rules than on the strip. I rent a car when in Vegas. The Gold coast had easy parking and access to the hotel, and the location was very convenient to getting out and around. It’s not fancy, and it’s not new, but if you want a lower priced stay in a great location this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Third trip and still our favorite!”
Reviews.Author: Kristasmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (both in our mid forties) stayed Sept. 20 and 21 on comps. Two other nights were at Harrah's. Check in was a breeze at 10:30 a.m. with no line. The woman behind the counter was fantastic and got us a room but it would not be ready for an hour. We went back an hour later and again no line and we got our room key cards. We got to our room ( I THINK it was room 955, I can't remember but it was on the 9th floor) and walked in and we were floored! The previous 2 times we stayed here we had old rooms with the tiny bathroom that you had to straddle the toilet to be able to close the door so we were amazed at this room. Completely remodeled with a flat screen tv and the bathroom had a glass walled shower and ample counterspace and the treasured coffee pot. There was a sliding door for the bathroom which made it seem even roomer. Our room was spotless and in good repair, the room tempurature was always comfortable and the bed was more comfortable than the one we have at home. We did not ask for an upgraded room but we certainly got one! The casino is so fun - the CW service was friendly and came around often and we played for hours on not tons of money. Won enough on the slots to keep playing without feeling like they were money vacuums. Six of us ate at the buffet for dinner. Good food, fantasic desserts and the best waitress we had for our entire 4 nights in Vegas. Drinks were replenished almost before our glasses were empty and when our waitress noticed we were starting dessert she brought a pot of coffee and cups without being asked just in case any of us would like a cup. Very impressive. The second day we ate at TGIF and I had delicious cajun shrimp alfredo. So Good. The iced tea was nasty like they swished a teabag thru an entire pitcher. The waitress was at our table 3 times. To take our order, drop off our food and drinks and to cruise by and slide the check on the table. There were only 2 other tables occupied so we were suprised at such poor service. We'll try another restaurant next trip. We got coffee at Seatle's Best and it was very reasonable at less than $3 for a large coffee! The shuttle service to the strip was very convenient but the wait can be fairly long toward evening when more people are riding it. Very polite drivers. We love Gold Coast and prefer its low key fun casino that you could have a conversation in unlike Harrah's casino machines were so loud we had to yell to the person next to you! Friendly, friendly, clean ! P.S. Even if we get an older room next time we will definately stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Premium rooms nicer than expected. Room service inexpensive.”
Reviews.Author: annietravelz
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel carefully by viewing images of the updated rooms and selected it because it was the least expensive, decent looking room for the weekend. I ate at the Seafood Buffet on Friday night: lots of good crab legs and every seafood dish you could imagine. I wanted oysters in the half-shell, but am used to Kumamoto and the ones on display were very sad looking. I tried some of the fried oysters instead. The sushi was very good and they had some decent ceviche. I think the Rio probably is better for their seafood buffet, however. Ping Pang Pong Dim Sum was some of the best dim sum I have had and the carts came around frequently and had a large selection of all dim sum favorites (except small duck plates). This restaurant was actually worth the trip since I can't get dim sum in Montana. Bingo hall was big and nice. Poker tournament was small and inexpensive buy-in - ok structure. Dealers were fine, but a few seemed inexperienced and not as fun as some dealers can be. Otherwise, hotel staff service was friendly and professional. Room service was quick and very reasonably priced. Room service is provided by TGI Fridays and you can get a good burger and nice glass of wine for under $20 including surcharges and tip. Room service was fast, even on a Saturday night. The room was updated (if you go for the premium room) and modern, clean, with nice beds, no tub, bathrooms a bit small, strange bathroom door configuration, carpets not as nice as the rest of the room decor but not as dingy as you would expect from this older hotel. TV was flat panel - a bit small. I got what I expected and this hotel would be a good choice - particularly if you come on a weekday and get the much lower rates. You could walk to the Rio and the Palms or take the free shuttle to the strip. I probably would stay at the Golden Nugget or elsewhere on Fremont street next time to be closer to more casinos and a variety of restaurants. If you have a wifi adapter you can pick up free wifi in the room and save the daily internet fee (at least I could from my room on the 9th floor). The resort fee is very low compared to most other hotels ($3 or $4 per stay, I think). Not much in the way of entertainment. Suggestion: Hotels could add an additional revenue stream by offering late-checkouts for a fee ($20) for those of us that have later flights. If the hotel has plenty of rooms that will be sitting unavailable anyway (depending on their occupancy rate for that day), they could make some good money for people willing to pay not to be rushed out of the room. They could easily add this option on the TV checkout menu.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but starting to lose it a bit”
Reviews.Author: ian101061
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time we have stayed at the gold coast in as many years and although very good value there do seem to be a few subtle changes that I feel may lose them customers. The rooms are clean but are starting to wear and need a bit of work. The evening buffet has changed to give a bit more variety but the breakfast is boring. The shuttle bus to the strip has changed its route and now does a round trip from gold coast to orleans then the strip and whereas before you could always get on a bus now you may have to wait for another. Some of the staff are so poor that this is the first time I refused to leave a tip. If you like a drink whilst gambling then the cocktail waitresses were few and far between with a couple being rude and ignorant so find the dutch waitress who was by far the most pleasant. I don't wish to make the hotel sound too bad as it is not. It is good value for money but next time I may pay a little bit more and visit another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great stay”
Reviews.Author: doey1013
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the Gold Coast in 2 years and we were very pleased again. We got the renovated room and it was very clean, and comfortable. The bedding was very soft, and the hotel was quiet so we got a good nights sleep. The casino, restrooms and grounds were all very clean. They have a security officer posted at the elevators so only guests could go upstairs, this made us feel very safe, not that we ever didn't feel safe here. There were always lots of people on the casino floor playing. On this trip we rented a car and the garage always had plenty of parking and the garage is not located miles from the casino like in other hotels. We played at both the tables and the slots. Drink service was fast and friendly. Some of the dealers seemed a little new and messed up a few times but the pit bosses made things right. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Worth giving it a shot .”
Reviews.Author: AfzalP
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Excellent professional service. Highly trained hosts especially Mr. Luis Hernandez & Gina Farr. We would definitely reccomend this place to all our friends. Keep it up, folks.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeahBelle22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for only 1 night on a comp visit. Since this is an older hotel, the pool is basic and the rooms are very outdated. The size of the room was small and the bathroom was even smaller. A plus is that they do have a bowling alley in the hotel which is open 24 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mintyclean
Reviews.Content: I have gone to GC for many many years and this time was so disappointed. It seems they are not keeping it up well. Rooms were clean but smelled musty/humid. We had two rooms across from each other and both smelled. i love their Bingo Hall convenience etc but this was my last stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: DiningdivaDallastx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business because my company booked me here for a trade show. The bed and shower are the only redeeming features about this property. There are no decent restaurants, no refrigerator in MY room, and the smoke hits you in the face the minute you walk in the door. Room was clean except for the floors.....Outdated, but you get what you pay for......NOT MUCH! Front desk was efficient and friendly, but even they couldn't make up for this hotel. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Met our needs.”
Reviews.Author: shmrq17
Reviews.Content: Wanted an inexpensive place to stay one night during the week we haven't stayed at before. This very much met our needs. Oh yeah, it needed nickel video poker. And it did, including some penny 50 play. It is on the west side of the freeway right next to the Rio and Palms. Rooms were good but not fancy. Don't have a single complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Casino.”
Reviews.Author: Joe37558
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to a Las Vegas Casino. I'm 55 yrs old and was not interested in the large crowd scenes you find at the strip. Gold Coast was in a perfect location a slight distance away from the strip. It had a generic and down to earth approach which I enjoyed. There were plenty of video machines and nice restaurants on the premises. Everyone was very kind. My wife enjoyed the Bingo Hall. Our room was easy to get to. I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem - Very surprized!!”
Reviews.Author: Mommy4ThreeGirls
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week long stay in Vegas. We had to attend a wedding and stayed on the Strip Sat-Sun and at the Gold Coast Sun-Fri. Our rooms on strip were very pricey so we wanted to stay some place reasonable and nice. We read many reviews and decided to try the Gold Coast, we were SHOCKED! It is a true 'bang for your buck'! The check was quick and easy, only took about 10-15 mins. We chose one of the new renovated rooms, they were very nice. Chic and moden, comfortable beds/pillows, nice TV and bathroom. We asked for a non-smoking room and when we opened the door, we could tell it had smokers in there, the bellman heard me say 'Phew it smells like smoke' and said I'll call down to the front desk to get you a new room and within 20 mins he was back up with a new key; we went right across the hall and it was great! Great Service! Most people do not like buffets but we had lunch there at the Port 'O Call each day, for $8 it is worth it! TGIF for dinner was great, as they have 24 Hour Happy hour, great deals on Apps. if you are not too hungry. Our 2 favorite hidden 'treasures' were Kates Korner for Ice Cream, there single scoop can feed to and reasonably priced, great little treat! And the huge 60 + lane bowling alley upstairs, which you can't hear while in the Casino (always a plus). They have a grave yard special $1 games, $1 Shoes, so we woke up early and went, nice and quiet! The only negative comment is the casino smells of smoke very bad. Almost all of the 'upscale' hotels seem to have air fresheners throughout the casino so you don't smell the smoke. This one you do and it started to bother me but what can you do. However the casino had the best pay outs we've seen yet! At night the tables were packed and the games were fun! All and all, we will def. be back next time!

Reviews.Title: “Yet another good expirience with Gold Coast”
Reviews.Author: primesteak
Reviews.Content: This Boyd Gaming property is off the strip over by the Rio and the Palms. There is easy access to both the center strip and the city center. The rooms are affordable and adaquate as is the casino. As far as food goes they have a tgf and a place called The Cortez Room which serves GOOD prime rib for like $20.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasently Surprised”
Reviews.Author: southernsurprise
Reviews.Content: Got the room through Priceline for 45 a night. I was VERY surprised. Check in was easy (we checked in very early). I asked for an upgraded room, and I was very very pleased. The room was nicely decorated, although the hallway was a little old looking. The beds were comfy and the bathroom was clean. The casino itself, I LOVED. I won the most money there, and they have low atm fees. The Fridays downstairs is convienant and inexpensive and the ice cream parlor was perfect. There is a Seattle's Best downstairs as well, and it was good for a quick breakfast. I visited the Port o' Calls buffet and it was not so good (but I don't like buffet type resturants-so you might enjoy it). The shuttle did run frequantly, but was always PACKED! Sometimes they ask for Hotel Keys to make sure that people who are staying there get priority. Once picked up at the gold coast, the shuttle takes you to the New Orleans Hotel and Casino (HUGE), and then to the strip, where they drop you off at Bill's Gambling Hall (on the corner right across from Caeser's Palace). I loved this hotel. The staff was friendly and the rooms were nice! I would stay here for parties at the Palms, because it is directly across the street. If you don't mind being off the strip, stay here, because it is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Gold Coast Hotel & Casino....a Nice Las Vegas 3-Star Property!”
Reviews.Author: BoneCrusherinArizona
Reviews.Content: I broken up my review in sections....over the 4th July Weekend. Rooms - Based on review comments on Travel Advisor; we ante up for the “Premium Room” vs the Standard “Deluxe Room”. A wise choice as the premium rooms were nicely updated, firm beds, 42 “ flat screen TV, coffee maker w/coffee (part of the reason for the $3.00 resort fee), however no in-room safe. The bathroom was a shower only, but hot water was abundant as was the counter tops (with a single sink). The only other small negative was the (1) one closet was part of the Entertainment Center and on the small side…..seems really meant for one guest's wardrobe. A nice feature……the windows (one at the rear of the room and one in the shower) actually opened. One funny note….leaving the Guest Elevators on our floor if you make a right at the hallway the Deluxe Rooms were located as noticed by the older hallway carpet. It almost like the Gold Coast split their Hotel in half…..right side Ghetto and left side Suburbs. I must assume they simply ran out of financing for the right side for upgrading. Meals – We ate at TGIFs which actually food wise was better than my previous experiences at TGIFs around the country. They have 24-hour half-off appetizers menu and drinks….not a bad deal. We tried the Buffet for breakfast one morning….not very impressive. We did enjoy my made to order omelets….otherwise forgettable. Casino – Surprising the table games were packed Saturday and Sunday….half locals and half tourists is my guess. The off-strip Hotels (Rio, Gold Coast, Palms, etc.) received quite a few visitors in town for the World Series of Poker. I don’t play slots, but based on my fellow travelers experiences they had fun. I placed couple of bets at the Sports book on my upcoming Detroit Lions, received (2) two complimentary drink tickets. The Cocktail Waitress service was fine. The one (1) single deck Blackjack Table has 6:5 BJ along with a long list of funky rules….skipped it! I played double-deck with 3:2 BJ and other than “Dealer Must Hit Soft 17” I was okay playing there. Based on my alcohol influenced memory, I was down the first night a few hundred and came back strong the second night up a couple hundred. Thank you, Gold Coast Casino!

Reviews.Title: “SHOCKED”
Reviews.Author: nancyrframe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paris for three nights then decided to add an extra day to our trip. Paris was sold out for the extra night so we went to the Gold Coast. (we had a voucher for a free night) It was awesome. The hallway on the 10th floor was really long and a lil' creepy. Our suite on the other hand, wonderful. Super clean, luxurious, definitely recently remodeled. The staff were very helpful. Surprisingly great!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: vic167
Reviews.Content: Just checked out after another great stay. This is not the Belligio, but then the Belligio doesn't cost $27 a night. As always clean rooms, great staff and wonderful rewards program. We actually made money gambiling and they still offered us a free weekend next month.( and no,we didn't win that much that they are trying to get it back, they just treat people right!) Our only complaint is their small pool but the Rio and its water park like pool is next door and lets you in free, so no big deal. Keep it up Gold Coast!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - Will return and recommend!”
Reviews.Author: megstev0
Reviews.Content: Travelled to the Gold Coast for New Year, after staying in Caesars Palace the year before (which cost an arm and a leg) we were a bit wary of the Gold Coast especially as it wasn't on the strip. What a waste of time worrying! Location: iliterally a ten min at the very max walk to the centre of the strip! Food: TGI - need I say more! We ate & drank there every night! Ping Pang POng resturant looked fab - we attempted to go there one night however saw a guy throwing up outside so it put me off but everyone in Vegas commentated how nice it was. Only used the buffett once for breakfast - Margaritaville was by far nicer in my opinion/even Dennys! Rooms: We stayed in a standard room which had adequate space for the 9 nights we were there. Really, if youre worried about the room, why go to Vegas! Theres so much to do that you shouldnt be in it! I found the slot machines and other gaming facilities like the poker room / blackjack and roulette were cheaper than the strip and I found to win more often!? The atmosphere is so much more relaxed and friendly than that of Caesars palace, Most of the locals tend to come to the casino here. Shop is so cheap with alcohol and tacky goodies too! The TGI's is such a bonus!!! GORGEOUS!! Overall I would and am about to book again. All of the people I know who have been to Vegas stay here. Was excellent at new year and I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Teri18
Reviews.Content: They have a bus to take you to the strip, drop & pick up points, back to the hotel. They have an eat all you can resto, with a lot of dishes to choose and the service is excellent, too. They have a reasonable price for every guest, just booked early. I'ved enjoyed our stayed there, hope you will, too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough Room...but sketchy bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Sue-ie
Reviews.Content: Went here with two of my girlfriends for a weekend of partying. The hotel was convenient and cheap...it was right in front of the Palms where we went to Rain night club, and also just a quick taxi ride to Wynn where we partied @ Tryst. The room we got had two beds, spacious, but the vanity area and bathroom were extremely tiny, and dirty. The tub was chipping and was a miscolored brownish/greenish color. Check in was quick, staff was friendly, and the buffet food left room to be desired. You're better off findin a Hometown Buffet...

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: FuzzyduckUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night only, as we were just passing through. The room was clean and a good size. The bath had burn marks on and looked a little bit shabby, but Vegas is a 24/7 place so We expected it to be well used. The lifts were very quick. We slept fine, my brother in another room was wakened a lot of the night, by revellers returning. Take earplugs. The shuttle bus takes you to the strip, which is helpful as it is out a little bit. Good price for what it was, somewhere to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to the premium room! The few extra dollars makes a world of difference”
Reviews.Author: Moose707
Reviews.Content: We had booked a premium room, which only cost $10 more, and we were so glad we did. We got to compare the two room types the hotel offers when they mistakenly gave us the standard room. Trust me, the extra $10 is totally worth it. The standard room didn't look modern at all, the worst part was the bathroom.....very very pokey and the shower was tiny. So once we told the hotel of their mistake, we moved to the premium room and were taken aback by the huge difference between the two rooms. This room was stylish, modern, with Asian-inspired decor. The bathroom was nice and roomy, and the shower was HUGE. We loved how close the Gold Coast is to everything, including the Rio hotel right next door with the Voodoo Lounge.....go there for the best view of the city!! You can't beat TGI Fridays located in the Gold Coast casino, we ate here for Valentine's Day and had a beautiful dinner. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best off strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: alanBridgwater
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this Hotel and it was certainly value for money,I know it's off the strip which we like as first thing in the morning we go down and get a coffee then sit and play a few slots befor going out for the bus and spend the rest of the day on the strip seeing the fountains, City Centre,Paris and all the great hotels with different thins to see and do.This time we caught the free bus to Orleans then crossed the main road and jumped on the bus to Crown n Anchor which was about three stops down Tropicana,I had a couple of pints of Guiness and Fish and Chips lunch which was great as I have wanted to go there for a while.I don't quite know what to make of City Centre I just hope they don't turn the Strip into a massive greenhouse as it would be a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mersimbo
Reviews.Content: Once again, we stayed for four days and had a great time. Had a couple of meals at the buffet, TGIF, and the Cortez Restaurant. I do wish they had more selection in the places to eat, like the Orleans has. Service and floor people were friendly, as always. We'll try to get back by the end of the year, depending on the deals they send us. Gambling is reasonable and we like the "locals atmosphere" and recognize many of the same people each visit. Didn't use the shuttle to the strip but did visit the Orleans. Its becoming more crowded so you need to allow enough time in case you have to wait for the next one. Had my 91 year old mother-in-law with us so took cabs to the strip to see a couple of shows. Always fun!!

Reviews.Title: “not much privacy”
Reviews.Author: julesmama
Reviews.Content: iv`e stayed in alot of hotel rooms,this is the first one that did`nt have a hallway in the entrance,which meant that as soon as you walk in the door or if maid opens door,even with rod lock in place ,there you are laying in bed.........also, the bathroom door is a sliding door with no lock, also no shower door or curtain....not for the timid so if your staying in a double room with friends or not quite friends you won`t have compleate privacy in the bathroom......also our room over looked apartment buildings not very resort like..........one other thing, the restaurant, ping pang pongs you better forget about that, expensive,no rice with entree that was seperate.........1st came my husband entree,15 minutes later was the fried rice we ordered xtra because it came with no rice,then after asking several times for my entree we got up and asked for bill of what we halfway ate and drank,they deducted the fried rice and gave me my entree no charge, to go, since now after 30 minutes after my husbands came it was ready........never in my life.........

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Peri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gold Coast since they just upgraded the rooms. We loved the place, it was clean and quiet, and the casino was very nice. This is a great place to stay and about 1/2 mile from the main part of the strip, they have a bus that runs people to and from the strip all day and no cost. You don't have to walk a mile to get to your room, it is not so big that you loose someone for hours and the price is always great. I would stay there again. They also have some nice restaurants to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “Fleas, homeless and no bedpreads.”
Reviews.Author: Jessie53
Reviews.Content: You know that old saying you get what you pay for. Well thats exactly what happened to me and my husband. We were on business only. So I did not expect much. 1. No bedpreads, I called housekeeping and he told me that we were in the section of the hotel that discontinued bedpreads. Ok so how about a blanket or two, Well we did get the blankets and the they were full of fleas. We got bites all over our body. Oh the pillows are hard as rocks, You can just imagine how many times I had to punch them in order to fall asleep. 2. Only one cup for coffee and the coffee pot has no pot. you have to put the cup under the coffee and let it pour into cup. 3. They allow homeless people to roam the floors. We saw this poor lady, At first I thought she was sick,she would not look at us in the face kept her head down. I though something was strange about her. We saw her several times on our floor and near the elevator on the 3rd floor. When we saw her standing on the corner. Thats when I really got upset. that was it. Never again. Poor security, How can they let this happen. All I can say is if this does not bother you, then you get what you pay for. I recommend this place for people who don't care, only want a bed to sleep in. For women in general don't even think about it.. Stay away from the (3rd) floor. If you get this floor ask for another. I am sure if we were to upgrade to a better room this would have never happened. I felt prejudice right away. Vegas is noisy and thats a given. People were drunk and loud all over the halls. If you want rest and good nite sleep. but yet want to be close to the stip then I would suggest The Tuscany or New Orleans. Ot better yet stay at one of the other 4 star hotels. this one is for faint at heart.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great time”
Reviews.Author: nuggetboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a 4 night stay in a premium room. The premium room has been recently renovated. It has a walk in shower and slightly larger bathroom area than the regular rooms. The rooms also have a flat screen TV and is a bit more upscale. The rooms are not larger than the regular ones. We've stayed at the GC several times before but usually in a regular room. We upgraded this time and asked for a high floor at the very end of the hallway. We figured there would be less noise. We were right but got an unexpected result. The water was not very hot. When we asked about this at the desk they said that the heaters were in the section of the building were the regular rooms were located. The further the water had to travel, the cooler it got. Since were were on the 8th floor at the very end, it was not hot. They said they have had complaints about this before. They offered to move us but It wasn't a real biggie to us. The water was good and warm, just not hot. That was the only problem. The place was clean and the employees friendly. Regarding the rooms, the even numbers face to the north and have a nice view of the mountains as long as you are high enough up. The odd numbers face the Palms casino and the sun. We prefer the mountains. The restaurants were very good and all had some kind of special running so eating was not expensive. The steakhouse, (Cortez Room) is a very nice place and a real bargain. We will be staying here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION - VALUE”
Reviews.Author: maggiefrench
Reviews.Content: This is the second year my companion and I have come to the Gold Coast during the NCAA playoffs. This hotel certainly doesn't offer the glitz and glamour the casinos on the Strip do, but it is reasonable alternative to those overpriced theme behemoths a few blocks away. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, towels were thick and incredibly white. The bathroom was tight and you need to do a little fancy footwork to get in the door. For the money, I was satisfied completely. The hotel sets up a ballroom for play-off viewing. They offer $2 drafts, $1 hotdogs, and other reasonably priced drinks and snacks. It's fun watching the game with so many people cheering for different teams, placing bets along the way. We walked to the Aria one afternoon and saw that their sports area required $20 / person/ hour to watch the games! (Do people actually do that?) The shuttle to the Strip runs frequently, we never waited more than 5 minutes. The $6 breakfast buffet is unbeatable - a variety of dishes plus made to order omelets. We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel rooms and easy location”
Reviews.Author: MrTWS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Las Vegas for 3 nights and picked the Gold Coast Hotel & Casino, and had a room on the 9th floor. The room was tidy, clean and modern, with a comfortable bed, shower/bathroom and flat screen television. Plenty of cupboard space and quiet at nights (although I expect most people were out gambling away their money). It has a "free" shuttle service that drops you off in the The Strip at Ballys, so it makes it simple to get there. Downstairs you have of course the casino, and food places (TGI Fridays did well out of us!) Two things that we found out (although we may have missed the "small print" somewhere. Internet access is available but not free - at $12.99 for a 24 period it seems a bit high considering how much they must take downstairs. On a positive note, one of the girls on the desk did give us a free pass for a 24 hour period as we had booked this hotel through hotels.com and the site had not made that point clear (at the time of booking anyway), so that was a good plus for their helpfulness and understanding. Also, you will need to pay what they term a "resort fee" of $3 per day as well, which again probably helps cover the so-called complimentary shuttle service, although it may very well be a Vegas tax scheme - I'm not sure to be fair. Hopefully their management can confirm what indeed it is?? Apart from that though there were no problems and the hotel, staff and general overall appearance was good. We would go back there again I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly casino that offers excellent value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Jens0
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this hotel and we were not disappointed. Very reasonable rates for room. Rooms clean and comfortable, and well serviced by maids every day. No noise day or night. Food in buffet excellent quality and really low prices. Free shuttle service to The Las Vegas Strip each day. We did not do much gambling, but what we did we enjoyed. It is the place that the locals visit frequently. Good, varied entertainment in Casino including a jazz/swing band that people (locals) danced to. Large bowling alley and bingo upstairs. Keno popular and very enjoyable. The Gold Coast Hotel and Casino is an excellent alternative to staying on the expensive, crowded Strip. Very friendly place. Small swimming pool and Jaccuzi area that is a pleasure to use as it is not crowded. Also, a small gym for guests use. Our only gripe. We did not find the Sunday Brunch Buffet worth bothering with. Try one of the bigger casinos on The Strip for the best "Brunch Experience". Apart from that, we would recommend this Hotel/Casino to anyone. Good location. Inexpensive. Good rooms and friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Cool,welcoming,and awesome little hotel”
Reviews.Author: alextraveler98
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the gold about a month ago and when we checked in we were welcomed by the check in desk. I have to say the TGIF in there has great service and food as well. To be specific I recommend ports-o-call buffet the most, its worth a trip. You would definitely find a good time at this hotel, you should stay here, its the best off strip hotel

Reviews.Title: “def. would stay again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Susie1974
Reviews.Content: the rooms were nice and well priced! the beds were soo comfortable!! i got a good snooze every night!! the shower i loved too!! roomy with a view of the rio sign lit up out the shower window!!! downstairs in the hotel, they had a T.G.I.Friday's resteraunt!! everybody there was very very nice!! we had a blast!!! would definately reccomend to people going without kids!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Inexpensive Off Strip Choice”
Reviews.Author: ktowntravllr
Reviews.Content: Got a great price for the night we arrived in Vegas. We were heading out of Vegas the next morning so really only wanted a place to sleep. Check in/out went very smoothly. Room was good except that the t.v. wasn't working. I didn't want to bother with someone from the hotel coming up because it was late so I tried to figure out why and eventually discovered it wasn't plugged in. Minor annoyance since I had to be a bit of a contortionist to plug it in. Coffee maker was filthy, but I was desperate in the morning so I cleaned it out myself. The room size and layout is exactly the same as Bill's I believe. Room an adequate size but bathroom layout a bit awkward. Location although off strip, is still quite close to the strip. I would definitely consider staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: JeannineS3
Reviews.Content: Love to play bingo, they have 1 hour session and have time to play slot for one hour and then bingo again, the food is good and the rooms were clean, what more can we ask for, we are two seniors from NH also other casino close by and a free shuttle to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “I Love the Gold Coast”
Reviews.Author: reninfresno
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas with friends that always stay at the Gold Coast every time they. I was told it was nothing fancy but they liked it and always had good experiences there. Well, guess what? I loved it!! So much I am taking my husband there next month for a romantic getaway. This time I am going for the premium room plus I got a great two nights free deal using my Gold Coast club card. I am so looking forward to watching the lights of Vegas come on at the Voodoo Lounge accross the street at the Rio and coming back to the Gold Coast for a fabulous prime rib dinner at the El Cortez Room. The bar in the middle of the casino has full paid poker and really nice bartenders, I plan on getting better at my poker hands! I have recommended this hotel to several friends since I'be been back who plan on checking it out the next time they go to Vegas. Reading some of the other reviews makes me want to stick up for the Gold Coast. It's not the Four Seasons after all, but for the reasonable price it pretty darn good!

Reviews.Title: “amazing value, love the vegas tackiness!”
Reviews.Author: stephysimbow
Reviews.Content: the gold coast was immense, it was beyond tacky but that's what made it fabulous! the $2 drinks, the lovely staff, the way the casino was still alive at 4am, amazing. on our first night there we were put into an 'old style' room, which wasn't the greatest, we were in a disabled room with a grab rail in the shower (ha ha), but we asked for a premium room for the rest of our stay, and it is SO WORTH IT. definitely upgrade. you walk down the corridor (stayed on the same floor) and then suddenly it turns into this trendy carpet and and we were taken to a gorgeous room! it was brill, and only around $50 a night! loved it. it is a bit off the strip (next to the rio and across from the palms) but there is a free shuttle bus taking you to and from the strip about every 15 mins which is very handy!! would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: CtTraveler12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights before going to Bally's for a convention. For 25 bucks a night and an upgraded room, it was absolutely wonderful!!!!!!!! The buffet is very good and is a great value also. We had lunch and dinner ...and was not disappointed. It's off the beaten path..which we really enjoyed!! They also have a bowling alley for the kids...great fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Off the Beaten Track, Snooty Staff”
Reviews.Author: PJ-Denver
Reviews.Content: I booked Gold Coast on the recommendation of my Cousin that lives in Las Vegas. When we got there I realized how FAR it was from the main Las Vegas drag - too far. We were exhausted, asked if we could check in and were told no, it would be 5 hours or more before we would be allowed to. The staff were condescending and snooty. The casino and eatery atmospheres were wonderful, and the other staff were really great. After hanging about for an hour, my companion and I decided to go elsewhere. I had stayed at Excalibur before, and said the acommodations were just fine there, and why don't we go there. Took Gold Coast shuttle to the Tropicana and across the street was Excalibur. The staff acted like we were lost relatives, so gracious, and said we could check in anytime, no waiting for the "official check in time". That rated highly with us - they wanted our business and weren't too big to "make us wait on their pleasure."

Reviews.Title: “Great value and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: brendonla
Reviews.Content: I booked four rooms total for 1 night Dec 27, 2009 -- our family just wanted a quick getaway and we wanted to take our inlaws, my 2 brother-in-laws and a girlfriend. I paid an extra $10 to get the more modern decor (Ikea-style furniture, but the bed was VERY comfortable!). The "deluxe" room is the same size as the standard room but with the more modern decor - had I known this I would have opted not to do this. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. This is NOT a luxury resort -- but for the price (all our rooms were less than $40) this is great value. Rooms were clean as were the linens; you get LCD TVs with HBO and cable thrown in. No in-room refrigerator (I think you can pay an extra fee for one...check with the hotel), but overall we really liked our room. About the same size as a standard room at a Hilton in Los Angeles/Pasadena where we're from. Staff was courteous and friendly -- I asked about comps or upgrades (I had booked 4 rooms afterall) but was told they don't give out the discount coupon booklets anymore and the property was booked solid.... We were able to get late checkout without any problem though. We didn't eat at the buffet, but did eat at the on-site TGIF -- like any other TGIF -- good food at a good price. The happy hour special at the casino bar was a GREAT deal -- check this out if you want to have a few cocktails before dinner or starting your evening. Since istwas winter and cold out, the pool was not available; we didn't have time to check out the workout room (but in honesty, I didn't come to Vegas to work out!). There is a free shuttle to the strip available that runs every 20 minutes, just make sure to show up in time to guarantee a seat (we ended up driving our own car over to the Mirage parking lot and parking for free, but the extra service is there for free if you want it and don't want to drive around....) Overall, we'd come back for the price we paid. This is not a luxury resort, but that is not the crowd Gold Coast caters to. But if you want a nice room at a great price with good amenities, this is a good choice. We almost booked at the Palms across the street, but having our 7-month old son with us, I'm glad we booked here instead. The staff actually fawned over him a bit here! ;-) And remember: you can stay here and walk across the street to the Palms and access all the bars there, as well as the big movie complex with IMAX screen...

Reviews.Title: “If you want luxury, stay at a luxury hotel, and pay the price!”
Reviews.Author: Krizstyling
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Gold Coast with my boyfriend and also had 2 other couples with us who had other rooms on our floor. We found a great rate on Orbitz (around 40 bucks a night) and we were only going down for a 4 day, 3 night weekend for the Mariah Carey concert at the Palms. This was a GREAT choice for us as it was right across the street from the Palms and walking distance even in heels! Check in: When we first checked in we were given a standard room. Upon arriving and checking it out we noticed the sink was dirty and there were stains on the door. We called down to the front desk and they moved us to an upgraded room on the 9th floor that was more expensive on Orbitz, but they did this upgrade for free. This room was MUCH MUCH BETTER! After settling in we were all pretty hungry so we went downstairs to get some food. The food: Honestly? We are all late twenties and early thirties and LOVED That they had a TGIF in the hotel. We ate there just about everyday (sad but true and it was great!). They had great happy hour specials (altho the free drinks in the casino were just as great!) but the food was half off during certain times and that was a surprise. Gave us more money to gamble with! Casino: We actually won more at Gold Coast than we did at the Palms. I lost it all at the Palms haha. Bingo was fun! We were just looking for something to kill time and found out that they had bingo! Well let me tell you, we played often and although we never won, it was extremely relaxing and fun! Okay maybe not so relaxing but it was fun! The staff in Bingo is great and very helpful! Beds: The beds in the upgraded room were great! Showers were great! No doors on the showers, I thought that would be a problem but it wasn't. Look, the bottom line is, you pay for what you get and in my opinion we received more from this resort than we paid for. In economic times like these, this is a great place to stay if there's a concert at the Palms or you just want to get away from all the hustle and bustle of the strip. However they have a great shuttle that took us to the strip and we had a lovely dinner at Joe's Steakhouse! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT! Swimming Pool: It was pretty decent. Nothing too fancy. Just enough to lay out and get some sun and go for a dip. Clean and decent. I recommend this hotel for people who are looking for a decent place at a cheap price and don't stay in the room much to care about the small things. Our room was cleaned daily and the staff was courteous. If we ever decide to take a quick trip to Vegas and are on a budget again we would totally stay here and be happy doing so. Tip: Make sure to sign up upon arrival for the Gold Coast Membership card! It's free and you earn points all week! We ended up getting a few bucks back and also saving money on things! I definitely made money back playing the slots for free play!

Reviews.Title: “Downhill Fast”
Reviews.Author: runningman5k
Reviews.Content: Stayed Dec. 24th-26th. Check-in met with an indifferent front desk clerk who would not honor my $10 food credit coupon. Room was below average. Stuffy double bed room with torn linens and rock-hard pillows. Very stingy with comps, even after playing a table for 3 hours averaging $50 bet per hand and tipping the dealers more than $250 during that time period. These facts after the refusal of buffet comps met with rudeness from the pit boss. Finally, the floor supervisor gave us buffet comps and acted like he was doing us a favor! I have been coming here since 1996 and believe me this place is on a downward spiral. I would recommend the Orleans over this place. They don't care about their out-of town hotel guest but only how much money they can suck out of the locals. Never again...

Reviews.Title: “Awfull experience”
Reviews.Author: nophobus
Reviews.Content: I don't usually take the time to post reviews for bad experiences but this was too much. The background to the story is my stepfather is dying from Leukemia and this was a family gathering for what we think would be our last time with him. I had family coming to visit for Christmas and booked 3 rooms at the Gold Coast all with double beds in order to accommodate everyone in our party. Well what does the hotel tell us?they don't have enough double beds.then I asked for rollaway beds and they said they cost extra and you get one per room.I explained the problem to their supervisor and he was no help.This was embarrassing to me because how are people supposed to sleep comfortably.They still would not help. Also the beds had very badly done linens with stains and there was no comforter/duvet on the beds just badly done ugly sheets. The rooms came with 2 free lunch buffets as described on the website. they only gave us 2 for 1 room and had to beg for them to give us 2 more and never mind the first room they gave us nothing. Well when family tried to use the free lunch buffet they were told the free tickets did not apply to Dec 25 ...hello! we checked in on Dec 24 thru the 26th.what a joke!! Overall this hotel made me look like an Idiot to Family,I was trying to make everyone comfortable and instead it was a horrible Christmas ordeal. I would never stay there again nor would I recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Leisure trip”
Reviews.Author: HortenseM
Reviews.Content: I would not want to stay in this hotel again. Good location. Rooms need remodeling. Hallways and rooms are stuffy. Housekeeper knocked at the door at 8:30 am and asked us if we were going to check out soon!! Buffet is just so so. Probably ok if you do not want to spend a lot of money on a buffet lunch or dinner. King beds are really queens beds, and queens beds are more like full size beds. Very uncomfortable mattresses. Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: PassOut76
Reviews.Content: There was a conference at the Rio and the special conference rate was about $90 a night. I went on TripAdvisor and could have gotten about a $70 rate through them but I found a $34 rate at the Gold Coast which is right next to the Rio. There was an additonal mandatory $5 a night resort fee but I was aware of it because of another review on Trip Advisor. Since budget was a major consideration, I booked at teh Gold Coast. Arriving on a Monday about 12:15 the front desk staff seemed overloaded. There were 2 people behind the desk and a line all day long. Since I was a little pressed for time I checked my bag at the bell desk and went for the afternoon conference sessions. Coming back at 5:30, the desk was still a bit overloaded. But I got in line and waited about 10 minutes. Reservations were on file and away I went. My room was on the 3rd floor facing the back parking lot. The room was clean, the king sized bed comfortable. The bathroom was small and but very functional for what I need to do in there. There was a coffee maker which was helpful as I was still on Central time and woke up rested at 6AM Pacific. Sine I really did not want to go down for breakfast, I made coffee in the room to take care of my vicious caffeine habit. The food trucks and garbage trucks came in with a bit of noise right below, not bad, but I was up anyway. Location: The Gold Coast is off the strip, it is a 20 minute brisk walk to Caesar's Palace across the freeway. There is a sidewalk next to the Flamingo Road. There is a shuttle but it is infrequent and the line is long to get on it. With my conference at the Rio, I could walk there in 5 minutes to the side door of the Rio if I went up to the 2nd floor of the parking ramp and walked down the stair and jaywalked across a very wide street. There was not so much traffic on the very wide street and with a center median it felt safe to do. Food: The buffet is fairly marginal. There are lots of choices though and I easily found things to my liking. The first day, the prime rib was tough and tasted a bit old. The Wednesday prime rib was better, I think owing to the marketing campaign of free buffet for seniors in their club. The package I got on line included 2 free buffets so budget ruled over palate. The TGI Fridays open 24 hours is nice. I ended up eating evening meals there, I am a fan of the Jack Daniels burger. Plus they enforced the non-smoking very well in TGI Fridays which I also enjoyed. Don't go in there if you plan to smoke. I used the hot tub facility, temp was good, very few people using it. Some thought the 70's temp too low for the pool area. I am a Minnesotan and thought it just lovely. Communications: I hate paying for internet, it drives me crazy. I can go to a dumpy motel in the middle of Montana and get free wireless but go to a $200 night hotel in Chicago and they want to tack on an additional $18. Here it was an additional $15. Not worth it.
